translated: Sarvarizukadharma-niryaate ture ture anâbhilâpa-târe tuttâre svâhâ.

original: cad nges par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: cad nges par 'gyur ba /
translated: These Târâs of the Noble Târâ, which are beyond verbal expression, are the ascertainment of all dharmas.

original: rang bzhin med cing mngon par brjod par byar med pa /🔽don thams cad sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin med cing mngon par brjod par byar med pa / don thams cad sgrub par byed pa /
translated: They are without intrinsic nature and beyond verbal expression.🔽They accomplish all aims.

original: nad thams cad gso bar byed pa /
analyzed: nad thams cad gso bar byed pa /

original: thams cad du bklags pas grub pa /
analyzed: thams cad du bklags pas grub pa /
translated: It is accomplished by mere recitation in all cases.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad dang / nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad las phran tshegs thams cad ji ltar ji ltar rab tu sbyar ba de lta de ltar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad dang / nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad las phran tshegs thams cad ji ltar ji ltar rab tu sbyar ba de lta de ltar sgrub par byed do //
translated: It will accomplish all minor activities, such as all fears and all harms, in whatever way it is employed.

original: 'di rnams kyi cho ga phyogs tsam ston par 'gyur te dkar po'i phyogs kyi tshes gcig nas brtsams te gso sbyong la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi cho ga phyogs tsam ston par 'gyur te dkar po'i phyogs kyi tshes gcig nas brtsams te gso sbyong la gnas pa'am /
translated: The mere side of the rite will be taught here. Beginning on the first day of the bright fortnight, one should observe the purificatory fast,

original: gso sbyong med pas kyang rung ste dri dang / me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis nyi ma re re la mchod pa byas nas 'bum phrag gcig bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong med pas kyang rung ste dri dang / me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis nyi ma re re la mchod pa byas nas 'bum phrag gcig bzlas par bya'o //
translated: or, if one does not observe the purificatory fast, one should make offerings every day with perfumes, flowers, and so forth, and recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times.

original: mthar nyin zhag gcig smyung bar gnas pas ras ris sam /
analyzed: mthar nyin zhag gcig smyung bar gnas pas ras ris sam /
translated: In the end, having fasted for one day and night, one should recite [the mantra] until the signs appear.

original: sku gzugs kyi spyan sngar ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste ji skad gsungs pa'i rim pas bdag nyid kha shar du phyogs te sngar brjod pa'i aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing sor bzhi pa'i tshad la zho dang; sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //🔽rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di 'am /
analyzed: sku gzugs kyi spyan sngar ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste ji skad gsungs pa'i rim pas bdag nyid kha shar du phyogs te sngar brjod pa'i aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing sor bzhi pa'i tshad la zho dang; sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o // rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di 'am /
translated: In front of an image of the Buddha, sitting on a bundle of kuśa grass, facing east, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight sticks of black agarwood, four finger-widths in size, smeared with curds, honey, and ghee, in the manner described above.

original: gzhan gang rung du sgrol ma'i rig pas brjod cing grol bar sbyong ba la rig pa mtha' yas pa grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gang rung du sgrol ma'i rig pas brjod cing grol bar sbyong ba la rig pa mtha' yas pa grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain infinite knowledge of the king of tantras, or of any other tantra, and will become skilled in the liberation of those who recite the knowledge mantra of Tārā.

original: ras ris gzhan 'dod na gso sbyong can gyis dkar po'i bco lnga la ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du sa la ma lhung ba'i ba lang gi @328b lcibs dkyil 'khor byugs te me tog dang / bdug pa dang / mar gyi mar me la sogs pas mchod pa byas nas au dum b'a ra'i shing gis sbar te tshangs pa'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste ts'a ru'i bza' bas yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ras ris gzhan 'dod na gso sbyong can gyis dkar po'i bco lnga la ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du sa la ma lhung ba'i ba lang gi @328b lcibs dkyil 'khor byugs te me tog dang / bdug pa dang / mar gyi mar me la sogs pas mchod pa byas nas au dum b'a ra'i shing gis sbar te tshangs pa'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste ts'a ru'i bza' bas yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should make a fire with udumbara wood and offer into it one thousand and eight oblations of brahma-sūtra grass.

original: 'o ma'i sbyin sreg byas pas bram ze rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma'i sbyin sreg byas pas bram ze rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: By offering oblations of milk, one will enthrall brahmins.🔽By offering oblations of cārumata, one will enthrall kṣatriyas.🔽By offering oblations of barley mixed with curds and cārumata, one will enthrall vaiśyas.🔽By offering oblations of sesame seeds, one will enthrall śūdras.🔽By offering oblations of rice, one will enthrall women.

original: tsa ru'i bza' bas sbyin sreg bya ste rgyal rigs dbang du 'gyur ro; ;nas dang / zho bsres pa dang / ts'a ru dang gcig tu byas nas sbyin sreg bya ste rje rigs dbang du 'gyur ro //🔽dgral bltas nas bzlas pa bya ste rengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsa ru'i bza' bas sbyin sreg bya ste rgyal rigs dbang du 'gyur ro; ;nas dang / zho bsres pa dang / ts'a ru dang gcig tu byas nas sbyin sreg bya ste rje rigs dbang du 'gyur ro //🔽dgral bltas nas bzlas pa bya ste rengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By offering oblations of śigru leaves, one will enthrall men.🔽By offering oblations of śigru leaves, one will enthrall men.

original: lan bdun mngon par sngags pa'i chus byabs pas thams cad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: lan bdun mngon par sngags pa'i chus byabs pas thams cad sel bar byed do //
translated: By sprinkling with water incanted seven times, one will remove all of them.

original: dug thams cad la'ang nye bar byabs pas so //
analyzed: dug thams cad la'ang nye bar byabs pas so //
translated: For all poisons, one should sprinkle.

original: zhu mkhan gyi ril bu lan bdun mngon par sngags pas mig nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: zhu mkhan gyi ril bu lan bdun mngon par sngags pas mig nad sel bar byed do //
translated: For an eye disease, one should incant seven times a pill made from the three spices, and apply it to the eyes.

original: na pa la skud pas bcing bar bya ste gdon thams cad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: na pa la skud pas bcing bar bya ste gdon thams cad sel bar byed do //
translated: For a sick person, one should tie a thread around the wrist; this will remove all grahas.

original: gtsug tor bcings pas bdag nyid srung ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor bcings pas bdag nyid srung ba'o //
translated: By binding the uṣṇīṣa, one will protect oneself.

original: thal bas dkyil 'khor bcing ba'o //
analyzed: thal bas dkyil 'khor bcing ba'o //
translated: By binding the maṇḍala with ashes,

original: bong ba la lan bdun bzlas pas phyogs bcing ba'o //
analyzed: bong ba la lan bdun bzlas pas phyogs bcing ba'o //
translated: one will bind the directions by incanting gravel seven times.

original: bud med bu ma thon pa la til mar la yongs su bzlas nas sbyin par bya ste bde blag tu btsa' bar byed do //
analyzed: bud med bu ma thon pa la til mar la yongs su bzlas nas sbyin par bya ste bde blag tu btsa' bar byed do //
translated: For a woman who is unable to give birth, one should give her a drink of oil incanted once; she will give birth easily.

original: rmongs pas mngal gyi zla mtshan gyi dus las 'das na khrus byas nas rgyud mtshungs pa'i 'o ma la stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags par byas nas btung bar sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rmongs pas mngal gyi zla mtshan gyi dus las 'das na khrus byas nas rgyud mtshungs pa'i 'o ma la stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags par byas nas btung bar sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If, due to delusion, she passes the time of menstruation during pregnancy, she should bathe and drink a potion of milk from a cow that has a calf of the same color, incanted one thousand and eight times.

original: gzhan gyi tshad dad mar bsres nas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshad dad mar bsres nas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should give it mixed with the ashes of another’s funeral pyre.

original: de @329a *// nas bu btsa' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de @329a *// nas bu btsa' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then one will give birth to a child.🔽“If one wants many children, one should offer eight thousand oblations of milk and ghee.

original: de nas bu mang po 'dod na sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas pa'i thal ba des chu'i bum pa bzhi dang bsres pa bzhag par bya'o; ;brgyad brgyar bzlas pa'i srad bus lag pa g-yas pa la bcings na ji srid du smra ba thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur
analyzed: de nas bu mang po 'dod na sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas pa'i thal ba des chu'i bum pa bzhi dang bsres pa bzhag par bya'o; ;brgyad brgyar bzlas pa'i srad bus lag pa g-yas pa la bcings na ji srid du smra ba thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur
translated: One should tie one’s right arm with a thread that has been enchanted eight hundred times.🔽One will become the best of all speakers.

original: ro // gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i me tog gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas te g-yul du gzhan gyis mi thub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro // gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i me tog gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas te g-yul du gzhan gyis mi thub par 'gyur ro //
translated: “If one offers eight thousand oblations of invincible flowers, one will become invincible in battle.🔽One should tie a knot in a thread spun by a young girl, enchant it seven times, and tie it on one’s arm.

original: gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i skud pa la mdud pa byas nas lan bdun mngon par sngags par byas nas lag pa la bcing bar bya ste brtan pa dang / g-yo bar bcas pa'i mnga' bdag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i skud pa la mdud pa byas nas lan bdun mngon par sngags par byas nas lag pa la bcing bar bya ste brtan pa dang / g-yo bar bcas pa'i mnga' bdag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become the lord of the moving and unmoving.

original: de nas drag shul la nyams pa'i ming nas smos te lan bdun mngon par sngags nas khyor ba'i chu btung bar sbyin par bya ste shi ba'ang langs par byed do //
analyzed: de nas drag shul la nyams pa'i ming nas smos te lan bdun mngon par sngags nas khyor ba'i chu btung bar sbyin par bya ste shi ba'ang langs par byed do //
translated: Then, having incanted seven times with the mantra, one should give him water to drink in a cup. Even one who is dead will rise up.🔽In the same way, having incanted in the four directions, one should give him water to drink. Even one seized by the fangs of a makara will be cured.

original: de bzhin du phyogs bzhir mngon par sngags par byas nas btung bar sbyin par bya ste 'jog po'i mche bas zin pa'ang 'tsho bar byed do; ;nu ma'i phur pa dang / 'bras la lan bdun mngon par sngags par byas nas byin pas grol bar byed de tshor ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bzhir mngon par sngags par byas nas btung bar sbyin par bya ste 'jog po'i mche bas zin pa'ang 'tsho bar byed do; ;nu ma'i phur pa dang / 'bras la lan bdun mngon par sngags par byas nas byin pas grol bar byed de tshor ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having incanted seven times a lump of breast-milk and rice, one should give it to him. He will be freed and will not feel pain.

original: yams dang / nye bar 'tshe ba dang / g-yul la grong khyer gyi dbus sam /
analyzed: yams dang / nye bar 'tshe ba dang / g-yul la grong khyer gyi dbus sam /
translated: In the case of an epidemic, a calamity, or a battle, in the middle of a town

original: mtshan mo mda' rgyang gang gi tshad kyis gzhi la nye bar byugs nas dkar gtor byin te 'o ma can gyi yam shing gis me sbar nas 'o ma'i sreg blugs @329b stong phrag gis sbyin sreg bya ste yams nye bar zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: mtshan mo mda' rgyang gang gi tshad kyis gzhi la nye bar byugs nas dkar gtor byin te 'o ma can gyi yam shing gis me sbar nas 'o ma'i sreg blugs @329b stong phrag gis sbyin sreg bya ste yams nye bar zhi bar byed do //
translated: or at night, one should anoint the ground with a distance of an arrow’s flight. Having given a white bali offering, having lit a fire with sticks from a milk tree, one should offer one thousand oblations of milk. The epidemic will be pacified.

original: de nas nye bar ma zhi na de las gzhan du rengs par bsams pa'i dus su bad kan mthar byed kyi yam shing gis me sbar nas don grub kyi shing la aaksha dang / til mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste 'phral du yams thams cad zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas nye bar ma zhi na de las gzhan du rengs par bsams pa'i dus su bad kan mthar byed kyi yam shing gis me sbar nas don grub kyi shing la aaksha dang / til mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste 'phral du yams thams cad zhi bar byed do //
translated: Then, if it is not pacified, one should think of paralyzing it. At that time, one should light a fire with wood for ending phlegm, and offer into it one thousand and eight oblations of akṣa wood smeared with sesame oil. All epidemics will be pacified immediately.

original: cho ga 'dis dug 'ching ngo //
analyzed: cho ga 'dis dug 'ching ngo //
translated: By this rite, poison is bound.

original: zlos bzhin pas ni sems can thams cad mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: zlos bzhin pas ni sems can thams cad mthong bar byed do //
translated: One who recites the mantra will be seen by all beings.

original: de rnams 'di'i 'bangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams 'di'i 'bangs su 'gyur ro //

original: kushm'anda'i yam shing gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste grul bum rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kushm'anda'i yam shing gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste grul bum rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One should offer one thousand and eight oblations of kusmanda wood. The kumbhāṇḍas will be enthralled.

original: til btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste yi dvags dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: til btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste yi dvags dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One should offer one thousand and eight oblations of sesame seeds. The pretas will be enthralled.

original: dur khrod du be la dang / khanda ka'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste sha za dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dur khrod du be la dang / khanda ka'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste sha za dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: In a charnel ground, one should offer one thousand and eight oblations of veṇu and kaṇṭakī wood. The piśācas will be enthralled.

original: gnod sbyin dbang du byed pa la wa ta'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste brjed byed dang / gnon po dbang du byed do //
analyzed: gnod sbyin dbang du byed pa la wa ta'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste brjed byed dang / gnon po dbang du byed do //
translated: For subjugating yakṣas, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of vāḍava sticks smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.🔽One will subjugate bhūtas and piśācas.

original: bal gyi sreg blugs kyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: bal gyi sreg blugs kyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of cotton sticks.

original: rig pas bgegs rnam par gzhom pa'i don du seng ldeng gi rtse mo la rnon po'i til mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: rig pas bgegs rnam par gzhom pa'i don du seng ldeng gi rtse mo la rnon po'i til mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: For the purpose of destroying obstacles by means of knowledge, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of khadira sticks smeared with sharp mustard oil.

original: gu gul gyi ril bu la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste lha chen po'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / lha chen po dbang du 'gyur ro //🔽dpa' bo'i rin @330a *//
analyzed: gu gul gyi ril bu la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste lha chen po'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / lha chen po dbang du 'gyur ro // dpa' bo'i rin @330a *//
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of guggul resin smeared with ghee.

original: gyis nyos pa'i ldong ros blangs nas rgyal po'i yam shing gis me sbar nas ji srid me dpung du gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gyis nyos pa'i ldong ros blangs nas rgyal po'i yam shing gis me sbar nas ji srid me dpung du gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should take red arsenic bought from a hero, light a fire with sticks of the royal punnāga tree, and recite the mantra until the fire becomes a mass of flames.

original: de nas rgyud mtshungs pa'i ba ser skya'i 'o ma la gzhon nu mas bsrubs pa'i mar du byas nas mar de la gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rgyud mtshungs pa'i ba ser skya'i 'o ma la gzhon nu mas bsrubs pa'i mar du byas nas mar de la gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then, having made it into clarified butter by churning the milk of a tawny cow of the same color as the thread, one should add it to the clarified butter.

original: de bzhin du zhos gang ba'i snod dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsis gang ba'i snod la yang ngo //🔽de nas srung ba byas te za ma tog tu bzhag nas zla ba gzas bzung ba na mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhos gang ba'i snod dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsis gang ba'i snod la yang ngo // de nas srung ba byas te za ma tog tu bzhag nas zla ba gzas bzung ba na mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /
translated: Similarly, one should do the same with a vessel filled with curd, ghee, and honey.🔽Then, having performed the protection rite, one should place the vessel in a box and, during a lunar eclipse, having fasted for three nights, one should make an offering in front of a stūpa containing relics or in front of the noble Avalokiteśvara, to the best of one’s ability.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs kyi drung du ji ltar 'byor ba'i mchod pa byas nas kha byang du mngon par phyogs pas snod bzhi ru bzhag nas ji srid 'gro ba dang / du ba 'thul ba'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs kyi drung du ji ltar 'byor ba'i mchod pa byas nas kha byang du mngon par phyogs pas snod bzhi ru bzhag nas ji srid 'gro ba dang / du ba 'thul ba'am /
translated: Facing north, one should place the four vessels and recite the mantra until the vessel moves, emits smoke,

original: 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //

original: dbang du byed pa dang / mi snang ba dang / nam mkha' la nye bar 'khrid par byed do //
analyzed: dbang du byed pa dang / mi snang ba dang / nam mkha' la nye bar 'khrid par byed do //
translated: It will bring under one’s control, make one invisible, and carry one through space.

original: de bzhin du mig sman bla bskyed pa'i ched du rang nyid khyad par du dkar po'i bco lnga la padma'i skud pa la bzhag nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs kyi drung du lag pa kha sbyar nas blangs nas ji srid dro ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig sman bla bskyed pa'i ched du rang nyid khyad par du dkar po'i bco lnga la padma'i skud pa la bzhag nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs kyi drung du lag pa kha sbyar nas blangs nas ji srid dro ba dang /
translated: Likewise, for the sake of increasing the eye ointment, one should place it on a lotus thread on the special fifteenth day of the bright fortnight, take it in one’s cupped hands in front of the feet of Ārya Avalokiteśvara, and recite the mantra until it becomes warm,

original: du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas pa bya'o //

original: 'di nyid la mngon pa rnams pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di nyid la mngon pa rnams pa gsum mo //
translated: In this very life one will attain the three superknowledges.

original: lcags lngas padma byed du bcug nas gur gum dang / gi wang dang / dbur nam mkha'i chus btags @330b nas padmar bcug ste de nas dkar po'i brgyad pa la gso sbyong can dus gsum du khrus byas nas gos gtsang ma bgos te ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /
analyzed: lcags lngas padma byed du bcug nas gur gum dang / gi wang dang / dbur nam mkha'i chus btags @330b nas padmar bcug ste de nas dkar po'i brgyad pa la gso sbyong can dus gsum du khrus byas nas gos gtsang ma bgos te ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /
translated: Having had a lotus made of the five metals, one should mix together saffron, bovine orpiment, and water from a sky-cleft vase, and place it in the lotus. Then, on the eighth day of the bright fortnight, one who has taken the purificatory fast should bathe three times a day, put on clean clothes, and place it in a caitya containing relics.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs kyi drung du lag pa g-yas pas padma blangs nas ji srid du 'bar bar byed pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhabs kyi drung du lag pa g-yas pas padma blangs nas ji srid du 'bar bar byed pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should take a lotus flower with one’s right hand at the feet of Noble Avalokiteśvara and recite the mantra until it blazes.

original: de nas blangs pa des rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te lo stong phrag bcur 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas blangs pa des rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te lo stong phrag bcur 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: Then, by taking it, one will become a vidyādhara and will live for ten thousand years.

original: de bzhin du gdu bu dang / cod pan dang / lcags sgrog rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gdu bu dang / cod pan dang / lcags sgrog rnams kyang ngo //
translated: In the same way, one should do the same with a bracelet, a diadem, and fetters.🔽In the same way, one should do the same with red sandalwood,🔽agalloch,🔽the root of jātī,🔽the five metals,

original: de bzhin du ri'i tsandan dmar po dang / gu gul dang / dga' ba 'khyil ba'i rtsa ba dang; lcags lnga dang / be ri karni ka dang / 'bru'i phub ma dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / sbrang rtsi dang / pi pi ling  dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du ri'i tsandan dmar po dang / gu gul dang / dga' ba 'khyil ba'i rtsa ba dang; lcags lnga dang / be ri karni ka dang / 'bru'i phub ma dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / sbrang rtsi dang / pi pi ling  dang /

original: du ru ka rnams cha mnyam pa gcig tu byas nas phye ma zhib mo byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: du ru ka rnams cha mnyam pa gcig tu byas nas phye ma zhib mo byed du gzhug go /
translated: One should make them into a single homogeneous substance and have them made into a fine powder.

original: de nas ser skya rgyud mtshungs par ba'i 'o ma blangs nas gzhon nu mas bsrubs pa'i mar sar dang gcig tu byas pas phye ma la ril bu byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: de nas ser skya rgyud mtshungs par ba'i 'o ma blangs nas gzhon nu mas bsrubs pa'i mar sar dang gcig tu byas pas phye ma la ril bu byed du gzhug go /
translated: Then, having taken the milk of a tawny-colored cow, one should make a pill out of the mixture of the ghee churned by a young girl and the powder.

original: aarga'i til mar gyi phye mas mar me dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: aarga'i til mar gyi phye mas mar me dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer a lamp with the powder of sesame oil and arka.

original: de nas dkar po'i bcu bzhi la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas gso sbyong can gyi aa shvattha'i 'dab ma bdun gyi nang du bcug par byas nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi spyan sngar ji srid du dro bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o
analyzed: de nas dkar po'i bcu bzhi la nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas gso sbyong can gyi aa shvattha'i 'dab ma bdun gyi nang du bcug par byas nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi spyan sngar ji srid du dro bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o
translated: Then, on the fourteenth day of the bright fortnight, having fasted for one day and one night, one should place the powder in the hollow of an aśvattha leaf, and in front of Ārya Avalokiteśvara, one should recite the mantra until it smokes.

original: // de khar bcug pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //🔽de nas 'bar bar byed @331a *//
analyzed: // de khar bcug pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro // de nas 'bar bar byed @331a *//
translated: By placing it in one’s mouth, one becomes invisible.

original: pas ni nam mkha' la 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: pas ni nam mkha' la 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Then, by causing it to blaze, one can fly through space.

original: de nas cho ga gzhan ni ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du sku gzugs kyi spyan sngar gso sbyong can gyis mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas me'i yam shing gis me sbar nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i seng ldeng gi yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: de nas cho ga gzhan ni ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du sku gzugs kyi spyan sngar gso sbyong can gyis mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas me'i yam shing gis me sbar nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i seng ldeng gi yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: “Then, the other rite: In a caitya containing relics, in front of an image, one who has taken the purificatory fast should make vast offerings and light a fire with sticks for kindling. One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of cutch tree smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: dkar po'i bcu bzhi nas brtsams te ji srid bco lnga'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i bcu bzhi nas brtsams te ji srid bco lnga'i bar du'o //
translated: Beginning on the fourteenth of the bright fortnight and continuing until the fifteenth,

original: de nas grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas grub par 'gyur ro //

original: de bzhin du gso sbyong can gyis rtag tu bzlas pa stong phrag gsum bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gso sbyong can gyis rtag tu bzlas pa stong phrag gsum bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one who has taken the purificatory fast should always recite the mantra three thousand times.

original: phyi nas las thams cad du 'gyur ro //🔽yang na rgyal po'am /
analyzed: phyi nas las thams cad du 'gyur ro // yang na rgyal po'am /
translated: Afterwards, one will be able to perform all activities.🔽“If one wants to enthrall a king

original: blon po dbang du byed par 'dod na bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas shing gi rgyal po'i yam shing la airgu da'i til mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: blon po dbang du byed par 'dod na bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas shing gi rgyal po'i yam shing la airgu da'i til mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: or a minister, one should make offerings to the Blessed One and offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of the king of trees smeared with sesame oil extracted from sesame seeds.

original: bcu bzhi nas brtsams te ji srid bco lnga'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bcu bzhi nas brtsams te ji srid bco lnga'i bar du'o //
translated: From the fourteenth day until the fifteenth day.🔽By this rite, even if one is immoral, one should kill and expel in the same way.

original: las 'dis tshul khrims 'chal pa yin yang de bzhin kho nar gsod pa dang / bskrad pa la ni mba'i yam shing la tsha ba'i til mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste mtshan mo bdun gyis skrod par byed do //
analyzed: las 'dis tshul khrims 'chal pa yin yang de bzhin kho nar gsod pa dang / bskrad pa la ni mba'i yam shing la tsha ba'i til mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste mtshan mo bdun gyis skrod par byed do //
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of chaff smeared with hot oil.

original: rigs bzhi dbang du byed par 'dod pas ts'a ru dang bcas pa'i chu dang / gnod sbyin gyi kham phor zhes pa'i sbyin sreg bya ste dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs bzhi dbang du byed par 'dod pas ts'a ru dang bcas pa'i chu dang / gnod sbyin gyi kham phor zhes pa'i sbyin sreg bya ste dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One should offer into the fire water with charu and the oblation called “yakṣa-pātra.”🔽One should offer into the fire puṣkara-jāta at night for eight thousand times.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.

original: mtshan mo pu tsi ra dza ta'i sbyin sreg @331b stong phrag brgyad bya'o //🔽bzlas pas 'ching ba las grol bar byed do //
analyzed: mtshan mo pu tsi ra dza ta'i sbyin sreg @331b stong phrag brgyad bya'o // bzlas pas 'ching ba las grol bar byed do //
translated: One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.

original: bgegs la phub ma dang / til gyi sbyin sreg gis gzhan gang yang rdung bas rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bgegs la phub ma dang / til gyi sbyin sreg gis gzhan gang yang rdung bas rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should offer into the fire chaff and sesame seeds.🔽One should offer into the fire the root of the śirīṣa tree.🔽One should offer into the fire chaff and

original: lan nyi shu rtsa gcig yongs su bzlas nas rigs kyi bu mo dbang du byed pa la til gyi sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: lan nyi shu rtsa gcig yongs su bzlas nas rigs kyi bu mo dbang du byed pa la til gyi sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: If one offers into the fire sesame seeds twenty-one times, one will enthrall a girl of good family.

original: gos 'dod pas d'ur ba dang / tsher ma can gyi sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: gos 'dod pas d'ur ba dang / tsher ma can gyi sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: If one wants clothes, one should offer into the fire cotton wool and thorns.

original: stong phrag brgyad dam //
analyzed: stong phrag brgyad dam //
translated: One should offer one thousand and eight oblations.

original: mtshan mo bdun du'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo bdun du'o //

original: shu dag la stong phrag brgyad lan bdun du mngon par sngags pa byas nas lag pa la'o //
analyzed: shu dag la stong phrag brgyad lan bdun du mngon par sngags pa byas nas lag pa la'o //
translated: One should incant seven times one thousand and eight white mustard seeds and tie them to one’s arm.

original: nor 'dod pas gu gul gyi ril bu 'am /
analyzed: nor 'dod pas gu gul gyi ril bu 'am /
translated: If one wants wealth, one should offer into the fire bdellium pills.

original: sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad mtshan mo bdun du bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad mtshan mo bdun du bya'o //
translated: For seven nights, one should offer one thousand and eight oblations.

original: khyim gyi bdag po 'dod pas dri'i sbyin sreg mtshan mo bdun du bya'o //
analyzed: khyim gyi bdag po 'dod pas dri'i sbyin sreg mtshan mo bdun du bya'o //
translated: If one wants to be the master of a house, one should offer into the fire perfume.

original: mar gyis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste grong rnyed do //
analyzed: mar gyis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste grong rnyed do //
translated: For seven nights, one should offer one thousand and eight oblations of ghee. One will obtain a village.🔽If one wants to drive someone out, one should offer into the fire neem tree leaves smeared with hot oil.

original: skrod pa la tsha ba'i til mar gyis btags pa'i nim pa'i 'dab ma'i sbyin sreg bya'o; ;skyes bu'i sha ni skrod par byed pa las so //🔽phub ma ni sdang bar byed pa las so //
analyzed: skrod pa la tsha ba'i til mar gyis btags pa'i nim pa'i 'dab ma'i sbyin sreg bya'o; ;skyes bu'i sha ni skrod par byed pa las so //🔽phub ma ni sdang bar byed pa las so //
translated: If one wants to cause enmity, one should offer into the fire chaff.

original: skrod par byed pa la sbrul gyi shun lpags dang / thal bas so //
analyzed: skrod par byed pa la sbrul gyi shun lpags dang / thal bas so //
translated: For driving out, with the skin of a snake and ashes.

original: skyes bu ma yin par byed pa la go ma aindra 'o //
analyzed: skyes bu ma yin par byed pa la go ma aindra 'o //
translated: For making someone not human, with the root of gomindhara.

original: phub ma mchu 'ching ba la'o //
analyzed: phub ma mchu 'ching ba la'o //
translated: For binding the lips, with the root of kritavedhana.

original: zhi ba'i don du shing sa mi'i 'dab ma rnams 'o ma dang lhan cig pas so //
analyzed: zhi ba'i don du shing sa mi'i 'dab ma rnams 'o ma dang lhan cig pas so //
translated: For the sake of peace, with the leaves of samī, together with milk.

original: ji ltar nyi ma so sor tho rangs langs nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar 'byor ba'i mchod pa byas nas 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma so sor tho rangs langs nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la ji ltar 'byor ba'i mchod pa byas nas 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Just as the sun, having risen every morning, having made offerings to the Blessed Buddha with whatever is available, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: ma grub pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: ma grub pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: It will accomplish what has not been accomplished.

original: gzhan gyi bsgrubs pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa la ma nu la 'ching ba 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsgrubs pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa la ma nu la 'ching ba 'dzin par byed do //
translated: For destroying the accomplishments of others, one should bind the root of mānu.

original: mtshan mo bdun du @332a *//
analyzed: mtshan mo bdun du @332a *//

original: tsher ma can gyi sbyin sreg bya ste dgra 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: tsher ma can gyi sbyin sreg bya ste dgra 'joms par byed do //
translated: one should perform a homa of thorny wood; it will destroy the enemy.

original: gos 'dod pas d'ur ba dang / tsher ma can gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: gos 'dod pas d'ur ba dang / tsher ma can gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One who desires clothing should perform eight thousand homas of cotton and thorny wood.

original: khyim rab tu g-yo par 'dod pas mi'i rus pa blangs nas sor brgyad pa'i tshad kyi phur bu byas nas khyim du gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim rab tu g-yo par 'dod pas mi'i rus pa blangs nas sor brgyad pa'i tshad kyi phur bu byas nas khyim du gdab par bya'o //
translated: “If one wants to shake a house, one should take human bone, make an eight-finger long kīla, and drive it into the house.

original: me tog la brgyad brgyar yongs su bzlas nas byin na dbang du 'gyur ro; ;rgyal po'i sgo ru gur gum dang / rgya spos dang / ta ma la'i 'dab ma dang bcas pa dang / me tog brgya pa sdong bu dang bcas pa rnams kyis ras dkris pa yang dag par ldan pa'i cho gas phye ma gos la btab pas mi'i dgra rab tu ldan pa la mi'i dgra dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog la brgyad brgyar yongs su bzlas nas byin na dbang du 'gyur ro; ;rgyal po'i sgo ru gur gum dang / rgya spos dang / ta ma la'i 'dab ma dang bcas pa dang / me tog brgya pa sdong bu dang bcas pa rnams kyis ras dkris pa yang dag par ldan pa'i cho gas phye ma gos la btab pas mi'i dgra rab tu ldan pa la mi'i dgra dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: “If one offers flowers enchanted eight hundred times, one will be enthralled. At the gate of the king’s palace, one should offer saffron, camphor, and tamāla leaves, as well as a hundred flowers with their stalks, enchanted with the mantra and smeared with unguent. One’s human enemy will be enthralled.

original: g-yul du rnam par rgyal bar byed pa la rgyal mtshan la stong phrag brgyad yongs su bzlas nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la bcom ldan 'das ma 'phags ma sgrol mas mngon par bsngags nas me thab tu mchod yon lan bdun phul nas mngag gzhug pas pha rol gyi sde la ston du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yul du rnam par rgyal bar byed pa la rgyal mtshan la stong phrag brgyad yongs su bzlas nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la bcom ldan 'das ma 'phags ma sgrol mas mngon par bsngags nas me thab tu mchod yon lan bdun phul nas mngag gzhug pas pha rol gyi sde la ston du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: For victory in battle, having enchanted a banner eight thousand times, with perfume, flowers, and incense, having invoked the Blessed Noble Tārā, one should offer libation seven times in the fire altar, and one should send forth the army to show oneself to the enemy.

original: shing la rdo rje'i thog ji ltar bar ro //
analyzed: shing la rdo rje'i thog ji ltar bar ro //
translated: Just as with the vajra thunderbolt on a tree.

original: til nag po la gzugs brnyan byas pa'i mdun du stong phrag bzlas te gang gis ming nas smos te za bar byed do //
analyzed: til nag po la gzugs brnyan byas pa'i mdun du stong phrag bzlas te gang gis ming nas smos te za bar byed do //
translated: Having enchanted black sesame seeds one thousand times, one should eat them, calling the name of the one for whom it is done.

original: stong phrag brgyad bzlas pas sa bon thams cad dam /
analyzed: stong phrag brgyad bzlas pas sa bon thams cad dam /
translated: By enchanting one thousand times, all seeds,

original: sman thams cad dam /
analyzed: sman thams cad dam /

original: dri thams cad dam /
analyzed: dri thams cad dam /

original: dri zhim po'i me tog rnams sam /
analyzed: dri zhim po'i me tog rnams sam /

original: padma rtsa ba nag @332b po med pa'i bum par bcug nas stong bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: padma rtsa ba nag @332b po med pa'i bum par bcug nas stong bzlas par bya'o //
translated: and black lotus roots, one should place them in a vase and enchant them one thousand times.

original: byang chub shing gi 'og tu 'am /
analyzed: byang chub shing gi 'og tu 'am /

original: gzhan yang rung ste khrus bya'o //🔽don grub dang / padma 'am /🔽padma'i 'dab ma dang / sdong bu dang / chu ba rnams kyi phye ma dang / seng ldeng gi sol ba rnams ming nas smos nas sbyin sreg bya ste dbang du 'gyur ro //🔽bil ba'i dbus su sbrang rtsi dang yang dag par ldan pa rnams kyis du ba dang / sol ba la stong phrag brgyad bzlas na rgyal po'i btsun mo 'am /🔽blon po 'am /🔽ming nas smos pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ste khrus bya'o // don grub dang / padma 'am / padma'i 'dab ma dang / sdong bu dang / chu ba rnams kyi phye ma dang / seng ldeng gi sol ba rnams ming nas smos nas sbyin sreg bya ste dbang du 'gyur ro // bil ba'i dbus su sbrang rtsi dang yang dag par ldan pa rnams kyis du ba dang / sol ba la stong phrag brgyad bzlas na rgyal po'i btsun mo 'am / blon po 'am / ming nas smos pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One should bathe with the ashes of the burnt🔽accomplished lotus, or lotus leaves, or stalks, or roots, or with the ashes of cutch tree wood, and one will become prosperous.🔽One should offer into the fire sesame seeds smeared with curds, honey, and clarified butter, and recite the mantra one thousand and eight times, saying the name of the person one desires to enthrall. One will enthrall a king's queen, or a king's minister, or a king's son, or a king, or a king's daughter, or a king's wife, or a king's brother, or a king's sister, or a king's friend, or a king's kinsman, or a king's counselor, or a king's doorkeeper, or a king's cook, or a king's physician, or a king's priest, or a king's servant, or a king's messenger, or a king's attendant, or a king's companion, or a king's relative, or a king's kinsman, or a king's friend, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king's companion, or a king

original: grub pa'i 'dod ma dbang du byed pa la til nag po /
analyzed: grub pa'i 'dod ma dbang du byed pa la til nag po /
translated: For subjugating a successful woman, black sesame seeds.

original: btsun mo'i mchog dbang du byed pa la pri yang ku /
analyzed: btsun mo'i mchog dbang du byed pa la pri yang ku /
translated: For subjugating a supreme queen, priyaṅgu.

original: sems can thams cad dbang du byed pa la s'a lu dmar po /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dbang du byed pa la s'a lu dmar po /
translated: For subjugating all beings, red rice.

original: gang gi ming nas smos te sbyin sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi ming nas smos te sbyin sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One should recite the name of the person for whom one performs the homa, and he or she will be subjugated.

original: gzhon nu ma'i ming nas smos te me tog ge sar gyis sbyin sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i ming nas smos te me tog ge sar gyis sbyin sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: For a young woman, one should recite her name and perform the homa with kesara flowers. She will be subjugated.

original: 'o ma dang / 'o thug dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsis bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg byas na gang gi ming nas 'bod pa de rgyas pa can gyi las so //🔽dkar po'i tshes gcig @333a *//
analyzed: 'o ma dang / 'o thug dang / mar dang / sbrang rtsis bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg byas na gang gi ming nas 'bod pa de rgyas pa can gyi las so // dkar po'i tshes gcig @333a *//
translated: In front of the Blessed One, one should perform a homa of milk, rice, ghee, and honey, one thousand and eight times. One should recite the name of the person for whom one performs the homa, and he or she will be subjugated.🔽This is the rite of Pūrṇabhadra.🔽One should begin on the first day of the bright fortnight.

original: nas brtsams te ring bsrel can gyi mchod rten nam /
analyzed: nas brtsams te ring bsrel can gyi mchod rten nam /
translated: In front of a caitya that contains relics,

original: sku gzugs sam /
analyzed: sku gzugs sam /

original: ras ris zhal nub du phyogs pa'i ras ris kyi spyan sngar ro //
analyzed: ras ris zhal nub du phyogs pa'i ras ris kyi spyan sngar ro //
translated: or a painting, with one’s face turned to the west,

original: sngon gyi mtha' ma ri'i rtse mo ku sha dang / bil pa'i yam shing gis me sbar nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i padma kha rgyas par bye ba'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ma ri'i rtse mo ku sha dang / bil pa'i yam shing gis me sbar nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i padma kha rgyas par bye ba'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya /
translated: Having lit a fire on the peak of a mountain with the kindling of kuśa grass and bilva wood, one should offer into it one thousand and eight oblations of fully blossomed lotuses smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: aa ga ru dang / kun tu ru ka dang / shri beshta ka rnams kyi bdug spos dang / 'o ma dang / zho'i gtor ma dbul bar bya zhing rnam pa gzhan du bgegs rnams la 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma sbyin no //
analyzed: aa ga ru dang / kun tu ru ka dang / shri beshta ka rnams kyi bdug spos dang / 'o ma dang / zho'i gtor ma dbul bar bya zhing rnam pa gzhan du bgegs rnams la 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma sbyin no //
translated: One should offer incense of agaru, tagara, and sriveshtaka, and oblations of milk and curds. Otherwise, one should offer the oblation of all spirits to the obstructors.

original: de nas brgyad pa la mnga' bdag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas brgyad pa la mnga' bdag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, on the eighth day, one will become a lord.

original: 'o ma dang / nas zan za pas padma dkar po kha rnam par rgyal ba'i sbyin sreg byas na gter chen po 'am /
analyzed: 'o ma dang / nas zan za pas padma dkar po kha rnam par rgyal ba'i sbyin sreg byas na gter chen po 'am /
translated: One who subsists on milk and barley gruel should offer into the fire white lotuses in full bloom. One will obtain a great treasure

original: yul rnyed do //
analyzed: yul rnyed do //

original: me tog ser po la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pas me la sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: me tog ser po la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pas me la sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire yellow flowers smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: yul gyi rje bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gyi rje bor 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become a king of a country.

original: mtshan mo gsum du phye za bar mtshan mo gsum du sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo gsum du phye za bar mtshan mo gsum du sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should offer oblations for three nights, eating sesame for three nights.

original: de bzhin du stong phrag bdun brgyas mtshams med pa byas pas kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong phrag bdun brgyas mtshams med pa byas pas kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, one who has committed the five acts of immediate retribution will also be successful with seven hundred thousand.

original: yam shing de nyid la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na gser bye ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yam shing de nyid la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na gser bye ba 'byung ngo //
translated: If one offers into the fire one hundred thousand oblations of sticks smeared with curds, honey, and ghee, one will obtain ten million in gold.

original: snga bar langs nas khrus sngon du 'gro bas tshangs par spyod cing me rab tu sbar nas n'a ga ge sar dang / pri yang ku'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad @333b bya ste zla ba gsum gyi nang du khyad par du 'phags pa'i dngos grub nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing rdzas mang po yang ngo //
analyzed: snga bar langs nas khrus sngon du 'gro bas tshangs par spyod cing me rab tu sbar nas n'a ga ge sar dang / pri yang ku'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad @333b bya ste zla ba gsum gyi nang du khyad par du 'phags pa'i dngos grub nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing rdzas mang po yang ngo //
translated: If one gets up early, performs ablutions, and offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of ironwood blossoms and jasmine flowers, one will experience the attainment of the highest substances within three months.

original: ba lang gi sha dang / khanda can gyi sbyin sreg byas na ba lang gi gnas rnyed do //
analyzed: ba lang gi sha dang / khanda can gyi sbyin sreg byas na ba lang gi gnas rnyed do //
translated: If one offers into the fire the meat of a cow and the meat of a dog, one will obtain the abode of cows.

original: de bzhin du pri yang ku dang / n'a ga ge sar gyi yam shing gis sbyin sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du pri yang ku dang / n'a ga ge sar gyi yam shing gis sbyin sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if one offers oblations of priyaṅgu and ironwood blossoms, one will gain power over others.

original: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams nas bil ba'i 'og tu me sbar nas bil ba dang / a'a shi bil ba rnams la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste lha mo sgrol ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams nas bil ba'i 'og tu me sbar nas bil ba dang / a'a shi bil ba rnams la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste lha mo sgrol ma mthong ngo //
translated: Beginning on the first day of a bright fortnight, one should light a fire under a bilva tree, and offer into it one thousand oblations of bilva and āśīvisa sticks smeared with ghee. One will behold the goddess Tārā.

original: gtsang mar gyur pas zas bzhir smyung bar gnas te stong phrag bcur sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: gtsang mar gyur pas zas bzhir smyung bar gnas te stong phrag bcur sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should fast for four days, and offer one thousand oblations of sesame seeds smeared with ghee.

original: gter chen po mthong ngo //🔽de bzhin du mtshan mo nyi shur 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas yungs kar dkar po'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste nor gyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gter chen po mthong ngo // de bzhin du mtshan mo nyi shur 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas yungs kar dkar po'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste nor gyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: One will see a great treasure.🔽Likewise, for twenty nights, eating only milk and barley, one should offer one thousand oblations of white mustard seeds. One will become a lord of wealth.

original: sngon spyad pa byas pas nyin mtshan du yungs kar dkar po la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg bya ste zla bas char rgyun bzang po ltung bar byed do //
analyzed: sngon spyad pa byas pas nyin mtshan du yungs kar dkar po la mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg bya ste zla bas char rgyun bzang po ltung bar byed do //
translated: One should offer one thousand oblations of white mustard seeds smeared with ghee. The moon will cause a good rain to fall.

original: zas bzhir smyung bar gnas pas stong phrag bcur sbyin sreg bya ste nor rnyed do //🔽mkhas pas dkar po'i phyogs 'byung 'gyur la lha mo'i ras ris kyi spyan sngar mkhas pas thun mtshams gsum du bsnun par bya'o //🔽dkar po'i phyogs kyi nang du de la lha mo 'di mchog sbyin par mdzad do //
analyzed: zas bzhir smyung bar gnas pas stong phrag bcur sbyin sreg bya ste nor rnyed do // mkhas pas dkar po'i phyogs 'byung 'gyur la lha mo'i ras ris kyi spyan sngar mkhas pas thun mtshams gsum du bsnun par bya'o // dkar po'i phyogs kyi nang du de la lha mo 'di mchog sbyin par mdzad do //
translated: “One should observe the four-day fast and offer ten thousand oblations of ghee. One will obtain wealth.🔽“One should offer oblations of sesame seeds one thousand times with this vidyā.🔽“One should light a fire with sticks of the dhak tree and offer into it one thousand oblations of sesame seeds.

original: rig pa 'dis til gyi sreg blugs stong gi sbyin sreg bya'o //🔽bil @334a *// ba'i shing gis me sbar na lha mo mthong ste nor ram /🔽'bru'i dbang phyug tu byed do //
analyzed: rig pa 'dis til gyi sreg blugs stong gi sbyin sreg bya'o // bil @334a *// ba'i shing gis me sbar na lha mo mthong ste nor ram / 'bru'i dbang phyug tu byed do //

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten gyi mdun phyogs gtsang mar lha la p'a la sha'i yam shing gis me sbar nas autpala'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na yul gru dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten gyi mdun phyogs gtsang mar lha la p'a la sha'i yam shing gis me sbar nas autpala'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na yul gru dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: In front of a caitya containing relics, in a clean place, one should light a fire with sticks of the dhak tree and offer into it one thousand and eight oblations of blue lotus flowers. One will obtain a country.

original: rig pa 'dis dri zhim po'i bdug pa phul nas 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas padma'i sbyin sreg stong bya ste gser stong rnyed do //
analyzed: rig pa 'dis dri zhim po'i bdug pa phul nas 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas padma'i sbyin sreg stong bya ste gser stong rnyed do //
translated: With this vidyā, one should offer fragrant incense, eat food of rice and milk, and offer one thousand oblations of lotuses. One will obtain one thousand dinars.

original: 'dis me tog gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na gang yid la sems pa de sbyin no //
analyzed: 'dis me tog gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na gang yid la sems pa de sbyin no //
translated: With this vidyā, one should offer one thousand oblations of flowers. One will obtain whatever one thinks of.

original: ras ris kyi spyan sngar sbyin sreg stong byas na gter mthong ngo //
analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar sbyin sreg stong byas na gter mthong ngo //
translated: In front of a painting, one should offer one thousand oblations. One will see a treasure.

original: pri yang ku la zho dang; sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas phyogs gtsang mar sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na gser brgya rnyed do //
analyzed: pri yang ku la zho dang; sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas phyogs gtsang mar sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na gser brgya rnyed do //
translated: In a clean place, one should offer one thousand and eight oblations of milk, rice, and honey mixed with ghee. One will obtain one hundred dinars.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phreng ba'o //
translated: One should offer a garland of various flowers.

original: de nas mtshan mo gsum du g-yul du smyung bar gnas pas aa ga ru'i yam shing gis thun mtshams gsum du sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mtshan mo gsum du g-yul du smyung bar gnas pas aa ga ru'i yam shing gis thun mtshams gsum du sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: Then, fasting for three nights in battle, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight sticks of agallochum three times a day.

original: de nas mtshan thog thag tu bzlas pas ras ris rab tu 'gul ba 'am /
analyzed: de nas mtshan thog thag tu bzlas pas ras ris rab tu 'gul ba 'am /
translated: Then, reciting throughout the night, the painting will tremble.

original: phreng ba'i chun po g-yo bar gyur na de nas 'grub par 'gyur te rgyal srid sbyin pa byed do //
analyzed: phreng ba'i chun po g-yo bar gyur na de nas 'grub par 'gyur te rgyal srid sbyin pa byed do //
translated: If the garland moves, then one will be successful and will be granted a kingdom.

original: gang yid la sems par byed pa @334b de ster bar byed de /
analyzed: gang yid la sems par byed pa @334b de ster bar byed de /
translated: Whatever one thinks of, that will be granted.

original: nad thams cad gso ba dang / shi ba dang / 'ching ba grol ba dang / sel ba dang / dkyil 'khor bcing ba'o //
analyzed: nad thams cad gso ba dang / shi ba dang / 'ching ba grol ba dang / sel ba dang / dkyil 'khor bcing ba'o //
translated: One will be cured of all diseases, and one will be freed from death, bondage, and misfortune, and one will be able to ward off the maṇḍala.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar me tog gis sbyin sreg stong bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar me tog gis sbyin sreg stong bya'o //
translated: In front of Noble Avalokiteśvara, one should offer one thousand flower sacrifices.

original: dbang du byed do //
analyzed: dbang du byed do //
translated: One will be brought under one’s sway.

original: yang na ras ris gcig byang chub kyi rtsa bar bzhag nas cho ga 'di nyid kyis nas zan za bas bzlas pa stong phrag brgya bya /
analyzed: yang na ras ris gcig byang chub kyi rtsa bar bzhag nas cho ga 'di nyid kyis nas zan za bas bzlas pa stong phrag brgya bya /
translated: Alternatively, one should place a painting in front of the Bodhi tree, and, eating barley gruel, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times, following the procedure as before.

original: zas gcig pas yan lag brgyad pa'i gso sbyong la gnas pas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zas kyi las rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas gcig pas yan lag brgyad pa'i gso sbyong la gnas pas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zas kyi las rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By eating only one meal, one who is established in the Poṣadha vow with eight parts will accomplish the ritual actions of the food of the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: yang na zla ba dang / nyi ma gzas bzung ba'i dus su 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ston ka'i sprin ltar dkar ba /
analyzed: yang na zla ba dang / nyi ma gzas bzung ba'i dus su 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ston ka'i sprin ltar dkar ba /
translated: Or, at the time of an eclipse of the moon or sun, one should have painted the noble Avalokiteśvara, white as the autumn clouds,

original: bla gos dkar po mnabs pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: bla gos dkar po mnabs pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //

original: gzhogs gcig tu lha mo sgrol ma gser mdog padma la gnas pa /
analyzed: gzhogs gcig tu lha mo sgrol ma gser mdog padma la gnas pa /
translated: On one side, one should have painted Tārā, golden in color, standing on a lotus,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /

original: sgrub pa po la kun nas gzigs par byed pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po la kun nas gzigs par byed pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //

original: dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / gtor ma'i mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas zla ba la mig lta bar ji srid zla ba grol gyi bar du bzlas pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / gtor ma'i mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas zla ba la mig lta bar ji srid zla ba grol gyi bar du bzlas pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Having made extensive offerings of perfume, flowers, incense, and sacrificial food, one should recite the mantra as long as the moon is visible, until the moon is released.

original: lha mo sgrol ma rang gi gzugs kyis 'bar ba /
analyzed: lha mo sgrol ma rang gi gzugs kyis 'bar ba /
translated: Tārā will appear in her own form, blazing,

original: nyi ma 'char ka'i mdog lta bu /
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ka'i mdog lta bu /
translated: He will arrive with the color of the rising sun,

original: padma kha bye ba phyag na bsnams pa 'byon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: padma kha bye ba phyag na bsnams pa 'byon par 'gyur ro //
translated: holding an open lotus in his hand.

original: mchod yon phul nas mchog zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: mchod yon phul nas mchog zhu bar bya'o //
translated: Having offered the welcoming drink, one should request the boon.

original: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams nas 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas bsgrub par @335a *//
analyzed: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams nas 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas bsgrub par @335a *//
translated: Beginning on the first day of the bright fortnight, one should perform the rite while subsisting on milk and barley porridge.

original: bya'o // yan lag brgyad pa'i gso sbyong can gyis me dang / lan tshva zos pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar gu gul gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // yan lag brgyad pa'i gso sbyong can gyis me dang / lan tshva zos pas ras ris kyi spyan sngar gu gul gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One who is observing the eight-part upavāsa should eat only fire and salt. In front of the painting, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of agalloch.

original: dong rtse brgyad rnyed do //
analyzed: dong rtse brgyad rnyed do //

original: kun tu ru ka'i las 'di'o //
analyzed: kun tu ru ka'i las 'di'o //
translated: This is the rite of the kunkuma.

original: bil ba'i yang las 'di'o //
analyzed: bil ba'i yang las 'di'o //
translated: This is also the rite of the bilva.

original: de ba d'a rus grub pa'i don du rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ba d'a rus grub pa'i don du rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply it for the sake of gaining wealth.

original: 'di ni rtsa ba'i rig pas aa ga ru'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rtsa ba'i rig pas aa ga ru'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: With the root knowledge, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight agalloch sticks.

original: 'o ma dang bcas pa'i shing gis me rab tu sbar na nor thams cad sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: 'o ma dang bcas pa'i shing gis me rab tu sbar na nor thams cad sbyin par byed do //
translated: If one offers into the fire sticks with milk wood, one will obtain all wealth.

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mchod pa byas nas snga bar langs te blugs gzar dang ldan pas me rab tu sbar nas n'a ga ge sar dang / pri yang ku'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya ste zla ba'i nang du blta bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mchod pa byas nas snga bar langs te blugs gzar dang ldan pas me rab tu sbar nas n'a ga ge sar dang / pri yang ku'i sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya ste zla ba'i nang du blta bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having worshipped a stūpa with relics with perfume, flowers, and incense, one should get up early, light a fire with sticks suitable for sacrifice, and offer into it one thousand and eight oblations of ironwood blossoms and jasmine flowers. One will see the moon.

original: be kang+ka ka ta'i yam shing la zho dang / sprang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
analyzed: be kang+ka ka ta'i yam shing la zho dang / sprang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of the crown flower plant smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: gtsang ma'i sngar gyi las kyi phyogs su p'a la sha'i yam shing gis me rab tu sbar nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas na gser brgya rnyed do //
analyzed: gtsang ma'i sngar gyi las kyi phyogs su p'a la sha'i yam shing gis me rab tu sbar nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas na gser brgya rnyed do //
translated: In a clean place, one should light a fire with sticks of the crown flower plant and offer oblations to the Blessed One. One will obtain one hundred measures of gold.

original: rig pa 'dis pri yang ku'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste gser stong rnyed do //
analyzed: rig pa 'dis pri yang ku'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste gser stong rnyed do //
translated: With this knowledge, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of jasmine flowers smeared with curds, honey, and ghee. One will obtain one thousand measures of gold.

original: rig pa 'dis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa phul nas au dum b'a ra'i yam shing gis me @335b rab tu sngar te sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa phul nas au dum b'a ra'i yam shing gis me @335b rab tu sngar te sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
translated: With this awareness, having offered perfume, flowers, and incense in front of Ārya Avalokiteśvara, one should light a fire with sticks of udumbara wood and offer into it one thousand oblations of ghee.

original: 'dod pa thams cad mchog dang lhan cig byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad mchog dang lhan cig byed do //
translated: One will obtain whatever one desires, together with the best.

original: mya ngan med pa'i shing gis me sbar nas yungs kar dkar po'i sbyin sreg brgya bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan med pa'i shing gis me sbar nas yungs kar dkar po'i sbyin sreg brgya bya'o //
translated: One should light a fire with sticks of the aśoka tree and offer one hundred oblations of white mustard seeds.

original: mngon sum du gzugs kyis 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: mngon sum du gzugs kyis 'ong bar byed do //
translated: He will come in person and grant his form.

original: bdug pa la lan stong phrag brgya bzlas nas gtsang mas gos gtsang ma gon te 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing rtag tu bzlas pas 'dod cing 'dod pa rnams kun tu thob ste 'dod pa thams cad sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: bdug pa la lan stong phrag brgya bzlas nas gtsang mas gos gtsang ma gon te 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing rtag tu bzlas pas 'dod cing 'dod pa rnams kun tu thob ste 'dod pa thams cad sbyin par byed do //
translated: Having enchanted incense one thousand times, one should offer it while clean and wearing clean clothes, eating food of milk and barley, and always reciting. One will obtain all that one desires. It will grant all that one desires.

original: sngon spyad pa byas pas mtshan mo lngar 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' ba 'am /
analyzed: sngon spyad pa byas pas mtshan mo lngar 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' ba 'am /
translated: Having performed the preliminary practice, for five nights one should eat food of milk and barley,

original: 'o ma 'thungs pas stong phrag brgyar bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o ma 'thungs pas stong phrag brgyar bzlas par bya'o //
translated: By drinking milk, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: mthar mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas zla ba nya la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis mngon par mchod na lha mo rang gi gzugs su mthong ngo //
analyzed: mthar mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas zla ba nya la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis mngon par mchod na lha mo rang gi gzugs su mthong ngo //
translated: Finally, having fasted for three nights, one should make a great offering on the full moon night with perfume, flowers, and incense. If one does this, one will see the goddess in her own form.

original: 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing yungs kar dkar po'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya 'o //
analyzed: 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing yungs kar dkar po'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya 'o //
translated: One should eat food of milk and barley, and make one hundred thousand oblations of white mustard seeds.

original: zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'o ma 'thungs pas aa p'a marg'a'i yam shing gis me rab tu sbar nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i yungs kar dkar po'i sbyin sreg stong bya'o //
analyzed: zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'o ma 'thungs pas aa p'a marg'a'i yam shing gis me rab tu sbar nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i yungs kar dkar po'i sbyin sreg stong bya'o //
translated: For twenty-one days, one should drink milk. Having kindled a fire with sticks of the aśoka tree, one should make one thousand oblations of white mustard seeds smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: 'o ma dang bcas pa'i yam shing gi me rab tu sbar na des nges pa nyid du gter mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'o ma dang bcas pa'i yam shing gi me rab tu sbar na des nges pa nyid du gter mthong ngo //
translated: If one kindles a fire with sticks together with milk, one will certainly see a treasure.

original: rig pa 'dis 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing bil ba'i shing gis me sbar nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i til gyis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na rang gi gzugs kyis lha @336a *//🔽mo mthong ngo //
analyzed: rig pa 'dis 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing bil ba'i shing gis me sbar nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i til gyis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya byas na rang gi gzugs kyis lha @336a *// mo mthong ngo //
translated: With this knowledge, eating milk and barley, one should light a fire with bilva wood and make a burnt offering of sesame seeds mixed with curds, honey, and ghee, one thousand times. One will see a goddess in her own form.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa phul nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i au dum b'a ra'i shing gis me rab tu sbar nas aarga'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste don du ma gnyer bar nor dang /🔽'bru rnyed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa phul nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i au dum b'a ra'i shing gis me rab tu sbar nas aarga'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste don du ma gnyer bar nor dang / 'bru rnyed do //
translated: In front of Noble Avalokiteśvara, one should offer incense, flowers, and perfume, light a fire with udumbara wood smeared with curds, honey, and ghee, and make a burnt offering of arka wood, one thousand times. One will obtain wealth and grain without having to strive for it.

original: lha'i shing gis me rab tu sbar nas de ba d'a ru'i sbyin sreg stong bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i shing gis me rab tu sbar nas de ba d'a ru'i sbyin sreg stong bya'o //
translated: One should light a fire with divine wood and make a burnt offering of devadāru, one thousand times.

original: rang gi gzugs kyis 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs kyis 'ong bar byed do //
translated: She will come in her own form.

original: mar gyi sbyin sreg gis zhi ba'o //
analyzed: mar gyi sbyin sreg gis zhi ba'o //
translated: With a burnt offering of ghee, there will be peace.

original: d'ur ba'i sbyin sreg gis rgyas pa can no //
analyzed: d'ur ba'i sbyin sreg gis rgyas pa can no //
translated: With a burnt offering of durvā grass, there will be prosperity.

original: zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas pas de bzhin du 'di'i nor thams cad rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas pas de bzhin du 'di'i nor thams cad rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of milk, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of curds, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of honey and ghee, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of milk, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of curds, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of honey and ghee, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of milk, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of curds, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of honey and ghee, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of milk, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of curds, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of honey and ghee, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of milk, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of curds, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of honey and ghee, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of milk, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of curds, one will obtain the same.

original: gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i skud pa la mdud pa nyi shu rtsa gcig byas te bu mo bag mar gtong bar byed do //🔽nub mo nyal bar 'dod pas rig pa dpag tu med pa bzla bar bya ste rmi lam ngan pa mi mthong ngo //🔽til nag po'i gzugs brnyan gyi mdun du brgyad brgyar bzlas na gang gi ming bsams par gyur pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i skud pa la mdud pa nyi shu rtsa gcig byas te bu mo bag mar gtong bar byed do // nub mo nyal bar 'dod pas rig pa dpag tu med pa bzla bar bya ste rmi lam ngan pa mi mthong ngo // til nag po'i gzugs brnyan gyi mdun du brgyad brgyar bzlas na gang gi ming bsams par gyur pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of honey and ghee, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of milk, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of curds, one will obtain the same.🔽If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of honey and ghee, one will obtain the same.

original: 'bru nag po la brgyad brgyar bzlas na gang gi ming nas brjod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //🔽dbang du byed pa la ras ris kyi spyan sngar aa p'a marga'i yam shing gi me la padma'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: 'bru nag po la brgyad brgyar bzlas na gang gi ming nas brjod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro // dbang du byed pa la ras ris kyi spyan sngar aa p'a marga'i yam shing gi me la padma'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of milk, one will obtain the same.

original: bil ba'i shing gi yam shing ngam /
analyzed: bil ba'i shing gi yam shing ngam /
translated: If one offers into the fire one

original: 'o ma dang bcas pa'i yam shing gis me rab tu sbar nas @336b padma stong phrag brgya sbyin sreg bya ste stobs kyi 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma dang bcas pa'i yam shing gis me rab tu sbar nas @336b padma stong phrag brgya sbyin sreg bya ste stobs kyi 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having made a fire blaze with sticks and milk, one should offer into it one hundred thousand lotuses. One will become a powerful universal monarch.

original: slar yang padma stong phrag bcus rgyal srid rnyed do //
analyzed: slar yang padma stong phrag bcus rgyal srid rnyed do //
translated: Again, by ten thousand lotuses, one will obtain a kingdom.

original: padma stong phrag brgya'i sbyin sreg gis longs spyod chen po rnyed do //
analyzed: padma stong phrag brgya'i sbyin sreg gis longs spyod chen po rnyed do //
translated: By one hundred thousand lotuses offered into the fire, one will obtain great wealth.

original: sbyin sreg 'di rnams thams cad la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mchod pa byas nas 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas sna ma'i me tog gis gang gi ming nas 'bod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin sreg 'di rnams thams cad la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mchod pa byas nas 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas sna ma'i me tog gis gang gi ming nas 'bod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: In all of these fire sacrifices, having made offerings with perfume, flowers, and incense, subsisting on a diet of milk and barley, whoever’s name one utters while offering jasmine flowers, they will be brought under one’s control.

original: bil ba'i yam shing gis brgyad brgyas me rab tu sbar nas padma stong phrag brgya sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: bil ba'i yam shing gis brgyad brgyas me rab tu sbar nas padma stong phrag brgya sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having made a fire blaze with one hundred and eight bilva sticks, one should offer into it one hundred thousand lotuses.

original: gang gi ming nas 'bod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi ming nas 'bod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever’s name one utters, they will be brought under one’s control.

original: gi wang gi byug pa la lan nyi shu rtsa gcig yongs su bzlas te mgo bo la byug par bya'o //
analyzed: gi wang gi byug pa la lan nyi shu rtsa gcig yongs su bzlas te mgo bo la byug par bya'o //
translated: One should anoint one’s head with a paste of bezoar, having enchanted it twenty-one times.

original: yang na gdong la thig le bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gdong la thig le bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, one should apply tilaka to the face.

original: skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be loved by all people.

original: padma'i sa bon la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya 'o //
analyzed: padma'i sa bon la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya 'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of lotus seeds smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: ming smos pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming smos pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: The one whose name one mentions will be brought under one’s power.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi drin las gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi drin las gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be favored by Noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: padma ma rnyed na autpa la sngon po stong phrag brgyad kyi sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: padma ma rnyed na autpa la sngon po stong phrag brgyad kyi sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: If one cannot obtain a lotus, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight blue lotuses.

original: dri 'am / me tog gi sbyin sreg bya ste 'bum phrag gcig gis lha rnams grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri 'am / me tog gi sbyin sreg bya ste 'bum phrag gcig gis lha rnams grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should offer into the fire one hundred thousand oblations of perfume or flowers.

original: khrus la sman thams cad dang / sa bon thams cad rtsa ba nag po med pa'i bum par bcug nas stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags pa'i chus khrus bya'o //🔽bgegs kyis btab pa'am /
analyzed: khrus la sman thams cad dang / sa bon thams cad rtsa ba nag po med pa'i bum par bcug nas stong phrag brgyad mngon par sngags pa'i chus khrus bya'o // bgegs kyis btab pa'am /
translated: For a ritual bath, one should place all the herbs and all the seeds, except for those of black plants, in a vase. One should perform the ritual bath with the water incanted one thousand and eight times.🔽One will be protected from obstacles.

original: bdag nyid zhi bar 'gyur @337a *//
analyzed: bdag nyid zhi bar 'gyur @337a *//

original: ro; ;autpa la dang / ru rta dang / aa ga ru'i cha dang / stag sen /
analyzed: ro; ;autpa la dang / ru rta dang / aa ga ru'i cha dang / stag sen /
translated: “One should offer a large pūjā to Noble Avalokiteśvara in front of the painting, light butter lamps, and, with all the ingredients, prepare a flower potion.

original: rgya spos bzhi 'gyur gyi cha rnams ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mchod pa rgya chen po byas te ba'i mar me rab tu sbar nas rdzas rnams thams cad me tog gis sbyor bas dus ma yin pa gang gis rgyal po🔽'am / rgyal po'i blon po 'am /
analyzed: rgya spos bzhi 'gyur gyi cha rnams ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mchod pa rgya chen po byas te ba'i mar me rab tu sbar nas rdzas rnams thams cad me tog gis sbyor bas dus ma yin pa gang gis rgyal po 'am / rgyal po'i blon po 'am /
translated: With whatever untimely [event] one is afflicted—🔽whether it is a king,

original: rgyal po'i btsun mo 'am /
analyzed: rgyal po'i btsun mo 'am /

original: sgrub pa po 'am /
analyzed: sgrub pa po 'am /
translated: a practitioner,🔽or someone who has passed away—
