original: tshe song ba rnams 'khrur gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe song ba rnams 'khrur gzhug par bya'o //
translated: one should bathe [them] with the flower potion.

original: tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have a long life.

original: skal pa bzang po bgegs kyis btab pa rnams bgegs las grol bar byed do //
analyzed: skal pa bzang po bgegs kyis btab pa rnams bgegs las grol bar byed do //
translated: Those afflicted with misfortune will be freed from misfortune.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi drung du nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas brahma d'a ri'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi drung du nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas brahma d'a ri'am /
translated: “In front of Noble Avalokiteśvara, one should fast for one day and one night and offer a large pūjā.

original: dzi tentra ya dang / aa ga ru dang / tu ru ka 'bum phrag gcig sbyin sreg bya ste de bzhin du'ang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dzi tentra ya dang / aa ga ru dang / tu ru ka 'bum phrag gcig sbyin sreg bya ste de bzhin du'ang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should perform a homa of one hundred thousand agaru and turuka sticks, and one will also be successful.

original: til nag po la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa dang / tsandan gyi phye ma 'am /🔽zhogs ma dang bsres pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: til nag po la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa dang / tsandan gyi phye ma 'am / zhogs ma dang bsres pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should perform a homa of one hundred thousand sticks of black sesame smeared with curds, honey, and ghee, or of sandalwood powder,🔽or of sesame seeds mixed with curds. One will be successful.

original: cho ga gzhan ni tsandan gyi yam shing sor bzhi pa'i tshad la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg 'bum byas te grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga gzhan ni tsandan gyi yam shing sor bzhi pa'i tshad la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg 'bum byas te grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Another rite: One should perform a homa of one hundred thousand sticks of sandalwood, four finger-widths long, smeared with curds, honey, and ghee. One will be successful.

original: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams ti bil pa'i shing gi 'og tu me nye bar sbar nas bil ba'i 'bras bu la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / @337b mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg 'bum phrag brgyad cu bya ste rang gi gzugs kyi lha mo mthong zhing rgyal srid chen po gnang bar byed cing gzhan yang gang zhus pa de gnang bar byed do; ;'byung po'i gdon grol bar byed pa la padma'i phyag rgyas reg🔽par bya ste 'bros par byed do //
analyzed: dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams ti bil pa'i shing gi 'og tu me nye bar sbar nas bil ba'i 'bras bu la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / @337b mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg 'bum phrag brgyad cu bya ste rang gi gzugs kyi lha mo mthong zhing rgyal srid chen po gnang bar byed cing gzhan yang gang zhus pa de gnang bar byed do; ;'byung po'i gdon grol bar byed pa la padma'i phyag rgyas reg par bya ste 'bros par byed do //
translated: One will see one’s own deity in bodily form and receive a great kingdom.

original: bsgrub par bya bzhin pa ma yin pa'i 'o ma'i shing gis me sbar nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang mar gyis btags pa'i padma'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bzhin pa ma yin pa'i 'o ma'i shing gis me sbar nas zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang mar gyis btags pa'i padma'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
translated: One should make an offering of one hundred thousand lotuses smeared with curds, honey, and ghee in a fire of unblamable milk-exuding trees.

original: de bzhin du autpa la dmar po dang / sngon po 'bum phrag gcig sbyin sreg bya zhing yang na sna ma'i me tog gi sbyin sreg go /
analyzed: de bzhin du autpa la dmar po dang / sngon po 'bum phrag gcig sbyin sreg bya zhing yang na sna ma'i me tog gi sbyin sreg go /
translated: Similarly, one should offer one hundred thousand red or blue lotuses, or jasmine flowers.

original: ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing 'phel bzhin pa'i mchod pa bya ste slong mo'i zas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing 'phel bzhin pa'i mchod pa bya ste slong mo'i zas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: In front of the painting, one should eat food of milk and barley, and one should eat the food of alms.

original: dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pa'i mthar dri zhim po'i me tog gis sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pa'i mthar dri zhim po'i me tog gis sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having made extensive offerings of perfume, flowers, and incense, at the end of fasting for a day and a night, one should perform a homa with fragrant flowers.

original: sgrub bzhin pa ma yin pa 'dis sa rnams tshul khrims mchog tu 'tshal pas kyang grub par byed do //
analyzed: sgrub bzhin pa ma yin pa 'dis sa rnams tshul khrims mchog tu 'tshal pas kyang grub par byed do //
translated: By this non-practice, one will also be successful in the practice of the supreme morality.

original: yang na yungs kar til nag po dang bsres pa zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
analyzed: yang na yungs kar til nag po dang bsres pa zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, one should perform a homa of one hundred thousand mixed white mustard seeds and black sesame seeds smeared with curd, honey, and ghee.

original: de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽nor 'dod pas aa p'a marga'i yam shing gis yungs kar rgyal po 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro // nor 'dod pas aa p'a marga'i yam shing gis yungs kar rgyal po 'am /
translated: One will be successful in the same way.🔽One who desires wealth should perform a homa of white mustard seeds or

original: ske tshe'i sbyin sreg go /
analyzed: ske tshe'i sbyin sreg go /
translated: sesame seeds with sticks of the apāmārga plant.

original: yang na blon po dbang du byed pa la til mar gyi sbyin sreg ste las thams cad la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na blon po dbang du byed pa la til mar gyi sbyin sreg ste las thams cad la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or, for bringing a minister under one's control, one should perform a sesame-oil oblation. This is to be applied to all rites.

original: bu mo dbang du byed @338a *//
analyzed: bu mo dbang du byed @338a *//
translated: For bringing a girl under one's control,

original: pal sngar gyi sbyin sreg zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pas so //
analyzed: pal sngar gyi sbyin sreg zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pas so //
translated: one should perform the previous oblation with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: rgyal po'i btsun mo la las 'di'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i btsun mo la las 'di'o //
translated: This is for the king's queen.

original: byang chub shing gi me sbar nas yongs su spyod pa'i sbyin sreg go /
analyzed: byang chub shing gi me sbar nas yongs su spyod pa'i sbyin sreg go /
translated: Having kindled a fire with bodhi tree sticks, one should perform the enjoyment oblation.

original: dbang du byed pa la yungs kar rgyal po'i sbyin sreg go /
analyzed: dbang du byed pa la yungs kar rgyal po'i sbyin sreg go /
translated: For bringing under one's control, one should perform an oblation of mustard seeds.

original: dbang du byed pa la kambo dzi ka'i me tog gi yam shing gis stong phrag brgya bya'o //
analyzed: dbang du byed pa la kambo dzi ka'i me tog gi yam shing gis stong phrag brgya bya'o //
translated: For bringing under one's control, one should offer one hundred thousand sticks of kamba flowers.

original: zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i byang chub shing gi yam shing gis me sbar nas thab med pa'i me la lha dang / lha mo la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mngon par mchod cing mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas 'o ma dang /
analyzed: zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i byang chub shing gi yam shing gis me sbar nas thab med pa'i me la lha dang / lha mo la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pas mngon par mchod cing mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas 'o ma dang /
translated: Having kindled a fire with bodhi tree sticks smeared with curds, honey, and ghee, in a fire without a hearth, one should make extensive offerings to the gods and goddesses with incense, flowers, and perfume, and offer milk,

original: nas zan za zhing gos gtsang ma bgos te gang blangs pa de ster bar byed do //
analyzed: nas zan za zhing gos gtsang ma bgos te gang blangs pa de ster bar byed do //
translated: One should eat barley and wear clean clothes, and give whatever one has obtained.

original: ba sha ka'i me tog phrag brgya sbyin sreg bya ste ming smos pa de dbang du byed do //
analyzed: ba sha ka'i me tog phrag brgya sbyin sreg bya ste ming smos pa de dbang du byed do //
translated: One should offer into the fire one hundred and eight vasaka flowers; the one whose name one mentions will become enthralled.

original: na le sham gyi sbyin sreg gis log 'dren rnam par 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: na le sham gyi sbyin sreg gis log 'dren rnam par 'joms par byed do //
translated: By offering into the fire of cutch tree sticks, one will destroy all obstacles.

original: byang chub shing gi 'og tu dri dang / me tog gis mngon par mchod nas zla ba gzas bzung ba na ldong ros blangs nas aa shvattha'i 'dab ma bdun gyis steng du gzhag nas ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub shing gi 'og tu dri dang / me tog gis mngon par mchod nas zla ba gzas bzung ba na ldong ros blangs nas aa shvattha'i 'dab ma bdun gyis steng du gzhag nas ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Under a bodhi tree, having made offerings of perfume and flowers, one should take up orpiment during a lunar eclipse, place it on seven aśvattha leaves, and meditate on it until it smokes, blazes, and flies up into the sky.

original: blangs pa des rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te lha thams cad thogs pa med pa dang / lha'i gzhal yas khang mchog tu mdzes par myur zhing mgyogs par 'gro ste nyi ma 'char ka'i mdog dang / gzi brjid dang ldan zhing rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad dang @338b ldan par 'gro ste lha'i 'gro ba brgya phrag gis yongs su bskor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blangs pa des rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te lha thams cad thogs pa med pa dang / lha'i gzhal yas khang mchog tu mdzes par myur zhing mgyogs par 'gro ste nyi ma 'char ka'i mdog dang / gzi brjid dang ldan zhing rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad dang @338b ldan par 'gro ste lha'i 'gro ba brgya phrag gis yongs su bskor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will quickly and swiftly go to the most beautiful celestial palace of the gods, with the color of the rising sun, endowed with splendor, and will go together with all the knowledge-holders, surrounded by hundreds of divine beings.

original: rna ba'i mig sman la las 'di kho na 'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i mig sman la las 'di kho na 'o //
translated: For the eye ointment of the ear, this is the procedure.

original: gi wang sgrub par 'dod pas 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas sngon du stong phrag brgya bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gi wang sgrub par 'dod pas 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas sngon du stong phrag brgya bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to accomplish gośīrṣa sandalwood should eat a diet of milk and barley, and first recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times.

original: zla ba gzas bzung ba'i dus su pi pi ling gi 'dab ma bdun gyi steng du 'am /
analyzed: zla ba gzas bzung ba'i dus su pi pi ling gi 'dab ma bdun gyi steng du 'am /
translated: At the time of an eclipse of the moon, one should grind seven leaves of long pepper on it,

original: ring bsrel can gyi mchod rten du gi wang rnam pa brgyar bya ste btang nas rig pa yongs su bskor pas las bya'o //
analyzed: ring bsrel can gyi mchod rten du gi wang rnam pa brgyar bya ste btang nas rig pa yongs su bskor pas las bya'o //
translated: or in a stūpa containing relics, one should grind gośīrṣa sandalwood one hundred times, and perform the rite while reciting the knowledge[-mantra].

original: nye bar spyod pa la sogs pa can te des thig le byas nas rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa'i lus 'dod pa'i gzugs can gyi rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te lo stong du 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa la sogs pa can te des thig le byas nas rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa'i lus 'dod pa'i gzugs can gyi rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te lo stong du 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: Having made a bindu with that, one will become a vidyādhara with a body of the form of one’s choice, adorned with all ornaments, and will live for one thousand years.

original: dpa' bo bzang po las byung ba'i mig sman gyi 'dab ma blangs nas me gdung bzang por byas nas lan brgyar rab tu bcug nas zla ba gzas zin pa na chur zhugs te ji srid du grul bum du gyur pa de srid du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo bzang po las byung ba'i mig sman gyi 'dab ma blangs nas me gdung bzang por byas nas lan brgyar rab tu bcug nas zla ba gzas zin pa na chur zhugs te ji srid du grul bum du gyur pa de srid du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: “One should take the leaf of the eye medicine that comes from the good hero, make a good fire, and heat it one hundred times. At the time of an eclipse of the moon, one should enter the water and recite the mantra until one becomes a kumbhāṇḍa.

original: skad cig la bcug pa tsam gyis rnam par zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig la bcug pa tsam gyis rnam par zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: As soon as one puts it in, it will be destroyed.

original: 'di byugs pas gzi brjid dang ldan zhing cod pan dang / rna rgyan 'chang ba /
analyzed: 'di byugs pas gzi brjid dang ldan zhing cod pan dang / rna rgyan 'chang ba /
translated: By applying it, one will become powerful, wearing a diadem and earrings,

original: padma'i phreng bas rnam par brgyan pa'i lus rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyi mthar thug par yang rab tu smon par 'gro'o //
analyzed: padma'i phreng bas rnam par brgyan pa'i lus rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyi mthar thug par yang rab tu smon par 'gro'o //
translated: and one’s body will be adorned with a garland of lotuses. One will go to the ultimate of all vidyādharas.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa lo stong phrag lngar 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa lo stong phrag lngar 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: One will live for five thousand years together with one’s retinue.

original: rlung ltar 'gro zhing yid ltar mgyogs par 'gro ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung ltar 'gro zhing yid ltar mgyogs par 'gro ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become a vidyādhara who moves like the wind and is swift like the mind.

original: padma dang / autpa la stong phrag brgya'i sbyin sreg gis gser stong rnyed do //
analyzed: padma dang / autpa la stong phrag brgya'i sbyin sreg gis gser stong rnyed do //
translated: By the homa of one hundred thousand lotuses and blue lotuses, one will obtain one thousand gold coins.

original: pa l'a sha'i las ni 'di kho na'o //
analyzed: pa l'a sha'i las ni 'di kho na'o //
translated: This is the rite of the pālaśa.

original: @339a *// yang 'dir las chen po'i sgrub thabs su 'gyur ba ni rgyal ba'i zhabs drung ngam /
analyzed: @339a *// yang 'dir las chen po'i sgrub thabs su 'gyur ba ni rgyal ba'i zhabs drung ngam /
translated: “Now, the rite of the great rite is as follows: In front of the painting,

original: ras ris kyi spyan sngar ram /
analyzed: ras ris kyi spyan sngar ram /
translated: in the presence of the Jina,

original: rtog pa gzhan las gsungs pa'i cho gas kyang rung ste rig pa 'di rnams kyi ming gsum gsum brjod pa'i ras ris kyi cho ga de 'am /
analyzed: rtog pa gzhan las gsungs pa'i cho gas kyang rung ste rig pa 'di rnams kyi ming gsum gsum brjod pa'i ras ris kyi cho ga de 'am /
translated: one should recite the three names of these vidyās according to the rite of the painting taught in other tantras.

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten gyi drung du phyogs gtsang mar 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / ts'a ru dang / rtsa ba dang / zho'i bza' ba 'am /
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten gyi drung du phyogs gtsang mar 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / ts'a ru dang / rtsa ba dang / zho'i bza' ba 'am /
translated: In front of a stūpa containing relics, in a clean place, subsisting on milk, barley-meal, or vegetables, beginning on the first day of the bright fortnight, with flowers, fruits, roots, milk, curd, and rice,

original: chu dang / phye dang / zan dang / dri'i bza' ba'am /
analyzed: chu dang / phye dang / zan dang / dri'i bza' ba'am /
translated: or with water, flour, rice, and perfume,

original: wa kra'i bza' ba'am /
analyzed: wa kra'i bza' ba'am /
translated: or with the food of the virtuous,

original: mar gyi bza' bas kyang rung ste yang na mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: mar gyi bza' bas kyang rung ste yang na mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs spyad par bya'o //
translated: or with ghee, one should practice the vow of silence.

original: thog mar sngon du bsnyen bar bya'o //
analyzed: thog mar sngon du bsnyen bar bya'o //
translated: First, one should perform the preliminary practice.

original: yan lag brgyad pa'i gso sbyong dang yang dag par ldan pas nyi ma so sor mngon par brjod bzhin pa'i mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad pa'i gso sbyong dang yang dag par ldan pas nyi ma so sor mngon par brjod bzhin pa'i mchod pa bya'o //
translated: Endowed with the eight-branched fasting observance, one should make offerings as prescribed, day by day.

original: gsung rab ji lta ba bzhin du slong mo'i zas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsung rab ji lta ba bzhin du slong mo'i zas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: One should eat the alms-food as prescribed in the scriptures.

original: byang chub kyi sems yongs su gzung zhing sdug bsngal gyi gdungs pas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yongs su gzung zhing sdug bsngal gyi gdungs pas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: One should eat, holding the thought of awakening, and with compassion for those in pain.

original: sgrub pa pos dus gsum du khrus byas pa'i 'og tu shis pa'i ku sha'i khres la 'dug ste sbyangs pa las byung ba'i gos bgo zhing 'bum phrag gcig tu bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos dus gsum du khrus byas pa'i 'og tu shis pa'i ku sha'i khres la 'dug ste sbyangs pa las byung ba'i gos bgo zhing 'bum phrag gcig tu bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The adept, having bathed three times, should sit on a bundle of kuśa grass, put on clothes made of jute, and recite one hundred thousand times.

original: mthar nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas seng ldeng gi shing gis me sbar nas 'o ma dang bcas pa'i shing dam /
analyzed: mthar nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas seng ldeng gi shing gis me sbar nas 'o ma dang bcas pa'i shing dam /
translated: At the end, having fasted for a day and night, he should light a fire with sticks of cutch wood and offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of cutch wood with milk,

original: aa ga @339b ru nag po'i yam shing sor bzhi pa'i tshad dam /
analyzed: aa ga @339b ru nag po'i yam shing sor bzhi pa'i tshad dam /
translated: or sticks of black aloe wood four fingerbreadths long,

original: mdzub mo'i tshad la tu ru ka'i til mar gyis btags pa dus gsum du stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo'i tshad la tu ru ka'i til mar gyis btags pa dus gsum du stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: or sticks of sesame smeared with turpentine oil, three times a day.

original: de nas grub par 'gyur te bco lnga la phyogs bzhir sa las byung ba'i bum pa bzhi chu dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de nas grub par 'gyur te bco lnga la phyogs bzhir sa las byung ba'i bum pa bzhi chu dang bcas pa /
translated: Then, when it is accomplished, he should place four earthen pots filled with water and

original: aa mra'i yal 'dab kyis kha g-yogs pa /🔽rtsa ba dang / nag po med pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: aa mra'i yal 'dab kyis kha g-yogs pa / rtsa ba dang / nag po med pa gzhag par bya'o //

original: g-yas kyi gzhogs su sa las byung ba'am /
analyzed: g-yas kyi gzhogs su sa las byung ba'am /
translated: on the ground in the four directions, without roots and without black.🔽On the right side he should place a pot of water

original: gser las byung ba rin po che dang / sa bon thams cad kyis yongs su gang ba /
analyzed: gser las byung ba rin po che dang / sa bon thams cad kyis yongs su gang ba /
translated: a jewel that comes from gold, and all seeds.

original: sman thams cad dang / rtsa ba dang / rin po che'i snying po padma dra ba'i me tog gis kha g-yogs pa /
analyzed: sman thams cad dang / rtsa ba dang / rin po che'i snying po padma dra ba'i me tog gis kha g-yogs pa /
translated: It is filled with all medicines, roots, and jewels, and is covered with the flowers of a net of lotuses.

original: du gu la'i ras ma nyams pas mgrin pa bcings pa /
analyzed: du gu la'i ras ma nyams pas mgrin pa bcings pa /
translated: It is bound at the neck with a strip of cloth from Dūgulapāṭala.

original: rnam par rgyal bzhes bya ba'i bum pa dbus su bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal bzhes bya ba'i bum pa dbus su bzhag par bya'o //
translated: The vase called Victorious should be placed in the center.

original: de bzhin du shar gyi phyogs su 'char ba zhes bya ba'i bum pa 'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar gyi phyogs su 'char ba zhes bya ba'i bum pa 'o //
translated: Similarly, in the east, the vase called Rising.

original: nub kyi phyogs su ha rings zhes bya ba'i bum pa'o //
analyzed: nub kyi phyogs su ha rings zhes bya ba'i bum pa'o //
translated: In the west, the vase called Harita.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa bum pa rnams kyi ming smos te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa bum pa rnams kyi ming smos te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The names of such vases should be mentioned, and the perfection of wisdom should be inserted.

original: dri bzang po'i me tog dang / gtor ma dang / phreng ba nyi shu dbul bar bya zhing dris bkang ba'i kham phor nyi shu phyogs bzhir dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dri bzang po'i me tog dang / gtor ma dang / phreng ba nyi shu dbul bar bya zhing dris bkang ba'i kham phor nyi shu phyogs bzhir dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Twenty flower offerings with fragrant water, twenty bali offerings, and twenty garlands should be offered, and twenty bowls filled with fragrance should be offered in the four directions.

original: 'o mas bkang ba'i kham phor nyi shu phyogs bzhir bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o mas bkang ba'i kham phor nyi shu phyogs bzhir bzhag par bya'o //
translated: Twenty bowls filled with milk should be placed in the four directions.

original: mar gyi mar me brgya dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mar gyi mar me brgya dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer one hundred butter lamps.

original: bum pa'i sgron ma bzhi rab tu sbar bar bya'o //🔽'o thug gis bkang ba'i kham phor bcu gnyis klu @340a *//
analyzed: bum pa'i sgron ma bzhi rab tu sbar bar bya'o // 'o thug gis bkang ba'i kham phor bcu gnyis klu @340a *//
translated: Four vase lamps should be lit.

original: rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Twelve bowls filled with rice porridge should be offered to the nāgas.

original: til gyi thug pa'i kham phor bcu gnyis srin po rnams la gtor ma mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: til gyi thug pa'i kham phor bcu gnyis srin po rnams la gtor ma mchod par bya'o //
translated: Twelve bowls of sesame porridge should be offered as a bali to the rākṣasas.

original: zan dron gyi kham phor brgyad 'byung po rnams la gtor mar sbyin no //
analyzed: zan dron gyi kham phor brgyad 'byung po rnams la gtor mar sbyin no //
translated: Eight bowls of barley porridge should be given as a bali to the bhūtas.

original: hvags kyi bca' ba la sogs pa'i gtor ma 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: hvags kyi bca' ba la sogs pa'i gtor ma 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: A bali of cakes made of flour and so on should be offered to noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: gzhan rnams la mar sar dang / zhos bkang ba dang / ji ltar 'os pa dang / ji ltar mtshungs pa'i kham phor rnams phyogs bzhir bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la mar sar dang / zhos bkang ba dang / ji ltar 'os pa dang / ji ltar mtshungs pa'i kham phor rnams phyogs bzhir bzhag par bya'o //
translated: For the others, bowls filled with ghee and milk should be placed in the four directions, as appropriate and as available.

original: aa ga ru nag po'i bdug spos dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: aa ga ru nag po'i bdug spos dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer black agarwood incense.

original: ga bur dang / tsandan dkar po dang / kun tu ru ka dang / shri b'a sa can gyi bdug pa'i kham phor phyogs bzhir bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: ga bur dang / tsandan dkar po dang / kun tu ru ka dang / shri b'a sa can gyi bdug pa'i kham phor phyogs bzhir bzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place in the four directions bowls of incense made of camphor, white sandalwood, saffron, and śrivāsā.

original: de nas srod la las brtsams par byas te nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas aarga'i yam shing ngam /
analyzed: de nas srod la las brtsams par byas te nyin mtshan du smyung bar gnas pas aarga'i yam shing ngam /
translated: Then, beginning in the evening, fasting day and night, one should light a fire with sticks of the aśoka tree

original: seng ldeng gi shing gis me rab tu sbar nas las 'di la sngags 'dis spyan drangs pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: seng ldeng gi shing gis me rab tu sbar nas las 'di la sngags 'dis spyan drangs pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: or sticks of cutch tree wood. In this rite, one should perform the invocation with this mantra:

original: sngags ni / na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: sngags ni / na mo ratna tra y'a ya /

original: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /

original: bo dhi satv'a ya /🔽mah'a satv'a ya /🔽hi ri hi ri /
analyzed: bo dhi satv'a ya / mah'a satv'a ya / hi ri hi ri /
translated: the bodhisattva,🔽the great being.🔽H Iri hi ri!

original: su ru su ru /
analyzed: su ru su ru /

original: mah'a k'a ru ni k'a a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha /
analyzed: mah'a k'a ru ni k'a a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha /

original: a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva ra dhi ri dhi ri ni /
analyzed: a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva ra dhi ri dhi ri ni /

original: ya th'a sa ma ya ma nu sma ra sv'ah'a //
analyzed: ya th'a sa ma ya ma nu sma ra sv'ah'a //

original: gshegs su gsol ba'i dus su dri zhim po'i me tog gis bskul bas so //
analyzed: gshegs su gsol ba'i dus su dri zhim po'i me tog gis bskul bas so //
translated: At the time of requesting departure, one should do so with fragrant flowers.

original: dngul las byung ba'i snod dam /
analyzed: dngul las byung ba'i snod dam /
translated: In a vessel made of silver,

original: sa las byung bar mchod @340b yon phul nas de nas aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing ji skad gsungs pa'i tshad gzhan gsungs pa la til mar gyis btags pa rnams zla ba gzas bzung ba'am /
analyzed: sa las byung bar mchod @340b yon phul nas de nas aa ga ru nag po'i yam shing ji skad gsungs pa'i tshad gzhan gsungs pa la til mar gyis btags pa rnams zla ba gzas bzung ba'am /
translated: Having made an offering to the earth, then, with sticks of black agarwood, the size as previously stated, smeared with sesame oil, when the moon is eclipsed,

original: nyi ma gzas bzung ba na stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gzas bzung ba na stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: or when the sun is eclipsed, one should perform eight thousand homa offerings.

original: de nas shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mchog tu thugs brtse ba /
analyzed: de nas shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mchog tu thugs brtse ba /
translated: Then, in the east and so forth, the noble Avalokiteśvara, supremely compassionate,

original: phyag na ril ba spyi blugs dang / dbyug pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag na ril ba spyi blugs dang / dbyug pa bsnams pa /
translated: holding a water pot and a staff,

original: ral pa'i cod pan 'phyang ba 'byon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan 'phyang ba 'byon par 'gyur ro //
translated: with a hanging topknot, will arrive.

original: de nas ji skad gsungs pa'i snod du dri zhim po'i me tog dkar po rnams snyim pas blangs nas chu'i mchod yon dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ji skad gsungs pa'i snod du dri zhim po'i me tog dkar po rnams snyim pas blangs nas chu'i mchod yon dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken white fragrant flowers in the palm of one's hand, in the vessel as previously stated, one should offer water for the feet.

original: de nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ci yin pa'i mchog te sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs par byed do //
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ci yin pa'i mchog te sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs par byed do //
translated: Then, the noble Avalokiteśvara will say, What is it? What is supreme? What should be given?

original: gang mchog blangs pa de ster ro //
analyzed: gang mchog blangs pa de ster ro //
translated: I will give whatever is supreme.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba 'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba 'am /
translated: I will give the power to fly in the sky,

original: mi snang ba 'am /
analyzed: mi snang ba 'am /

original: rgyal po nyid dam /
analyzed: rgyal po nyid dam /

original: rig pa'i dngos grub thams cad dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po nyid dam /
analyzed: rig pa'i dngos grub thams cad dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po nyid dam /
translated: all the powers of knowledge, the state of a king of knowledge-holders,

original: mtshon cha 'am /
analyzed: mtshon cha 'am /

original: tshe ring po nyid dam /
analyzed: tshe ring po nyid dam /

original: sems can thams cad dbang du byed pa 'am /🔽gi wang sgrub pa'am /🔽mig sman sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dbang du byed pa 'am / gi wang sgrub pa'am / mig sman sgrub pa'am /
translated: the power to enthrall all beings,🔽the power of the eye medicine,🔽the power of the eye ointment,

original: gter 'pho ba'am /🔽phug tu 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: gter 'pho ba'am / phug tu 'jug pa'am /
translated: the power of the eye salve,

original: bcud len nam /
analyzed: bcud len nam /

original: ldong ros sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: ldong ros sgrub pa'am /
translated: the power of the collyrium,🔽the power of the five superknowledges,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga nyid dam; rang gi lus la rjes su 'dod pa'i cho ga 'am /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga nyid dam; rang gi lus la rjes su 'dod pa'i cho ga 'am /
translated: the power of the rite of the body of one’s desire,

original: lha'i mig gam /
analyzed: lha'i mig gam /
translated: the power of the divine eye,

original: nad 'joms pa'am /
analyzed: nad 'joms pa'am /

original: lha'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: lha'i shes pa'am /

original: lag pa dang / rkang pa'am /
analyzed: lag pa dang / rkang pa'am /
translated: the power of the hands and feet,

original: mig cha dang bral ba nyid dam /
analyzed: mig cha dang bral ba nyid dam /
translated: the power of being free from eye disease,

original: lha'i @341a *// dbang po sbas pa nyid dam /
analyzed: lha'i @341a *// dbang po sbas pa nyid dam /
translated: the power of being hidden like the lord of gods,

original: nad 'joms pa nyid dam /
analyzed: nad 'joms pa nyid dam /
translated: the power to destroy disease,🔽and the power of the divine ear.

original: mdze 'am / lus la gang cung zad bsgrub bya min pa'i nad de dang / de rnams la de las thar ba dang / thos pa 'dzin pa dang / nor sgrub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: mdze 'am / lus la gang cung zad bsgrub bya min pa'i nad de dang / de rnams la de las thar ba dang / thos pa 'dzin pa dang / nor sgrub pa nyid dam /
translated: leprosy, or whatever other illness there may be, and from those [illnesses] he will grant the attainment of freedom from them, retention of what is heard, and the attainment of wealth,

original: gang blangs pa'i mchog de sbyin par mdzad do //
analyzed: gang blangs pa'i mchog de sbyin par mdzad do //

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi gnas su 'ang 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi gnas su 'ang 'gro'o //
translated: He will also go to the abode of the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: tshe bskal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe bskal par 'gyur ro //
translated: His lifespan will be an eon.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'phags ma sgrol ma'i sgrub pos ku sha'i khres yod pas au dum b'a ra'i cho ga shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'phags ma sgrol ma'i sgrub pos ku sha'i khres yod pas au dum b'a ra'i cho ga shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know the procedure of the udumbara flower with the seat of the noble Tārā, the Blessed One.

original: au dum b'a ra'i shing gi shing lham gnyis sam /
analyzed: au dum b'a ra'i shing gi shing lham gnyis sam /
translated: With two shoes made of udumbara wood,

original: rdza mkhan gyi sa la de nas thams cad mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi sa la de nas thams cad mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: or with the potter's clay, everything is equal.

original: sgrol ma'i mchog tu gsang ba'i nye ba'i snying po'i cho gar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrol ma'i mchog tu gsang ba'i nye ba'i snying po'i cho gar 'gyur te /
translated: It will be the procedure of the supreme secret essence of Tārā.

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /

original: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva r'a ya; bo dhi satv'a ya /🔽mah'a satv'a ya /
analyzed: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva r'a ya; bo dhi satv'a ya /🔽mah'a satv'a ya /

original: aom ku ru ku ru kulle sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom ku ru ku ru kulle sv'ah'a /

original: 'di ni rig pa 'di thams cad kyi mchog tu gsang ba'i nye ba'i snying po ste bzlas pa tsam gyis 'jigs pa thams cad gnon par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni rig pa 'di thams cad kyi mchog tu gsang ba'i nye ba'i snying po ste bzlas pa tsam gyis 'jigs pa thams cad gnon par byed do //
translated: This is the supreme secret essence of all these vidyās. Merely by reciting it, one will overcome all fears.

original: nad thams cad zad cing 'joms so //
analyzed: nad thams cad zad cing 'joms so //
translated: It will destroy and overcome all diseases.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad 'joms par byed do //

original: las phran tshegs rnams kyang bklags pas 'grub bo //
analyzed: las phran tshegs rnams kyang bklags pas 'grub bo //
translated: Even minor rites will be accomplished by merely reciting it.

original: 'bum phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu zlos par byed pa ni nam mkha' la 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bum phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu zlos par byed pa ni nam mkha' la 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: One who recites it twenty-one hundred thousand times will be able to fly through the sky.

original: de nas mig sman ldong ros aa shv'attha'i 'dab ma bdun gyis nang du ji srid dro bar gyur ba de srid du bzlas @341b par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mig sman ldong ros aa shv'attha'i 'dab ma bdun gyis nang du ji srid dro bar gyur ba de srid du bzlas @341b par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should recite the vidyā until the eye medicine, red arsenic, becomes warm inside seven leaves of aśvattha.

original: do bar byed bzhin pas ni dbang du byed do //
analyzed: do bar byed bzhin pas ni dbang du byed do //
translated: While it is smoking, it will enthrall.

original: du ba 'thul bas ni mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: du ba 'thul bas ni mi snang ba'o //
translated: While it is smoldering, one will become invisible.

original: 'bar bas ni nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'bar bas ni nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
translated: While it is blazing, one will fly up into the sky.

original: til gyi sreg blugs 'bum gyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: til gyi sreg blugs 'bum gyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one hundred thousand oblations of sesame seeds.

original: gang 'dod pa de ster bar byed do //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa de ster bar byed do //
translated: One will obtain whatever one desires.

original: 'bum phrag bcu gcig bzlas par bya ste ji srid du 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bcu gcig bzlas par bya ste ji srid du 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mthong bar byed do //
translated: One should recite [the mantra] eleven hundred thousand times, until one sees Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: de mthong na gang brtsams pa de 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: de mthong na gang brtsams pa de 'grub par byed do //
translated: When he is seen, whatever one undertakes, that will be accomplished.

original: tsandan dkar po'i yam shing gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste nyim so sor la dong tse rnyed do //
analyzed: tsandan dkar po'i yam shing gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste nyim so sor la dong tse rnyed do //
translated: One should offer one hundred thousand oblations of sticks of white sandalwood; every day one will obtain one silver coin.

original: tsandan dmar po'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste nyi ma re re la kar sha pa na drug rnyed do //
analyzed: tsandan dmar po'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste nyi ma re re la kar sha pa na drug rnyed do //
translated: One should offer one hundred thousand oblations of sticks of red sandalwood; every day one will obtain six karṣa-panas.

original: 'bum phrag bdun bdun bzlas par bya ste mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bdun bdun bzlas par bya ste mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should recite [the mantra] seven hundred thousand times; one will become invisible.

original: 'bum phrag lnga bzlas par bya ste nad 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: 'bum phrag lnga bzlas par bya ste nad 'joms par byed do //
translated: One should recite [the mantra] five hundred thousand times; one will destroy disease.

original: mtshan mo brgyad du lan gsum yongs su bzlas pas nad 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan mo brgyad du lan gsum yongs su bzlas pas nad 'joms par byed do //
translated: By reciting [the mantra] three times a night for eight nights, one will destroy disease.

original: 'bum phrag bcu gnyis bzlas par bya ste bcud len dang / bcud rnyed do //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bcu gnyis bzlas par bya ste bcud len dang / bcud rnyed do //
translated: One should recite [the mantra] twelve hundred thousand times; one will obtain an elixir and find nourishment.

original: de zos nas gnyer ma dang / skra dkar spangs par 'gyur ro; ;'bum phrag gsum gyis gri dha sh'i sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de zos nas gnyer ma dang / skra dkar spangs par 'gyur ro; ;'bum phrag gsum gyis gri dha sh'i sel bar byed do //
translated: By reciting three hundred thousand times, one will cure gridhrasi.

original: lcags bsregs nas lan gsum bzlas pa'i til mar gyis rkang ba g-yas pa la bskus nas lcags des rkang pa la gdung par bya zhing gri dha sh'i chod cig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lcags bsregs nas lan gsum bzlas pa'i til mar gyis rkang ba g-yas pa la bskus nas lcags des rkang pa la gdung par bya zhing gri dha sh'i chod cig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having anointed the right foot with sesame oil, heated in a heated iron pan, with the recitation of the mantra three times, one should heat the foot with that iron pan, saying, “Cure gridhrasi!”

original: 'bum phrag gnyis bzlas pas rgyal po'i btsun mo dbang du byed do //
analyzed: 'bum phrag gnyis bzlas pas rgyal po'i btsun mo dbang du byed do //
translated: By reciting two hundred thousand times, one will enthrall the king’s queen.

original: yungs kar rgyal po'i sreg blugs byas pas dbang du 'gyur @342a *//
analyzed: yungs kar rgyal po'i sreg blugs byas pas dbang du 'gyur @342a *//
translated: By offering oblations of mustard seed, one will enthrall.

original: zhing mtshan mo bdun gyis nor gyi bdag por 'gyur te 'dod pas nye bar bzhag pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: zhing mtshan mo bdun gyis nor gyi bdag por 'gyur te 'dod pas nye bar bzhag pa ma gtogs so //
translated: Within seven nights, one will become the lord of wealth, except for what is set aside by desire.

original: m'arga la 'bum bzlas te bskul na bza' btung gang blangs pa de rnyed do //
analyzed: m'arga la 'bum bzlas te bskul na bza' btung gang blangs pa de rnyed do //
translated: If one recites one hundred thousand times and invokes Marga, whatever food and drink one takes, one will obtain that.

original: aarga'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg byas na gser sad brgyad rnyed do //
analyzed: aarga'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg byas na gser sad brgyad rnyed do //
translated: By offering oblations of arka wood, one will obtain eight gold coins.

original: shing pi n+ya ki gi sbyin sreg bya ste skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing pi n+ya ki gi sbyin sreg bya ste skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should offer one thousand and eight oblations of piṇyāka seeds; one will be loved by all people.

original: t'ambu la'i phye mas sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste cod pan 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: t'ambu la'i phye mas sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste cod pan 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should offer one hundred thousand oblations of tamāla powder; one will obtain a turban.

original: bye ba bzlas par bya ste 'khor brgyas bskor ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye ba bzlas par bya ste 'khor brgyas bskor ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should recite one hundred million times; one will become a vidyādhara surrounded by a retinue of one hundred.

original: 'bras yos kyi bsregs blugs stong phrag brgyad kyi sbyin sreg bya ste nyi ma bdun gyis bgegs rnams med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras yos kyi bsregs blugs stong phrag brgyad kyi sbyin sreg bya ste nyi ma bdun gyis bgegs rnams med par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should offer one thousand and eight oblations of parched rice; in seven days all obstacles will be removed.

original: 'bum phrag bcu gnyis bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bum phrag bcu gnyis bzlas par bya ste /
translated: One should recite twelve hundred thousand times;

original: ba lci skam po hvags kyi btso bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lci skam po hvags kyi btso bor 'gyur ro //
translated: one will become a master of the dry and the moist.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;

original: rtsa ba med pa 'am /
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa 'am /
translated: one will become a master of the rootless and the rootless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;

original: dug med par brjod pas bskus na dri bzang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dug med par brjod pas bskus na dri bzang por 'gyur ro //
translated: one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.

original: t'ambu la thams cad yang dag par sbyar te 'bum gyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: t'ambu la thams cad yang dag par sbyar te 'bum gyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should recite one hundred thousand times;

original: t'ambu la mtshang ba nyid med par 'gyur ro //🔽aa p'a margas mig nad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: t'ambu la mtshang ba nyid med par 'gyur ro //🔽aa p'a margas mig nad sel bar byed do //
translated: one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will become a master of the odorless and the odorless.🔽One should recite one hundred thousand times;🔽one will

original: rims kyis btab pa la ku shas byabs pas so //
analyzed: rims kyis btab pa la ku shas byabs pas so //
translated: For one who is afflicted with fever, one should sprinkle with kuśa grass.

original: srad bu la brgyad brgya bzlas nas bcing bar bya ste skal ba bzang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srad bu la brgyad brgya bzlas nas bcing bar bya ste skal ba bzang por 'gyur ro //
translated: Having enchanted a thread one hundred and eight times, one should tie it on; one will have good fortune.

original: zan dang / zho lhan cig pa 'bum gyis sbyin sreg byas na ji srid 'dod pa'i zas ma tshang ba @342b med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zan dang / zho lhan cig pa 'bum gyis sbyin sreg byas na ji srid 'dod pa'i zas ma tshang ba @342b med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers into the fire one hundred thousand oblations of rice and curds together, one will obtain food as much as one desires.

original: mar gyi sreg blugs stong gi sbyin sreg byas na yul gru gsum rnyed do //
analyzed: mar gyi sreg blugs stong gi sbyin sreg byas na yul gru gsum rnyed do //
translated: If one offers one thousand oblations of ghee, one will obtain three villages.

original: bsod nams chung ba'i sems can rnams kyis sgrub pa lan gsum gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes sa //
analyzed: bsod nams chung ba'i sems can rnams kyis sgrub pa lan gsum gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes sa //
translated: For those sentient beings of little merit, one should perform the sādhana three times.

original: gu gul gyi ril bu ka par sha'i rus pa'i tshad kyi sbyin sdreg stong phrag brgya bya /
analyzed: gu gul gyi ril bu ka par sha'i rus pa'i tshad kyi sbyin sdreg stong phrag brgya bya /
translated: One should offer into the fire one hundred thousand guñja-sized bdellium pills.

original: nyi ma re re la pan bcu drug rnyed do //🔽lhag ma med pa zad par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma re re la pan bcu drug rnyed do // lhag ma med pa zad par bya'o //
translated: One will obtain sixteen paṇa every day.🔽One should offer into the fire one hundred thousand oblations of ghee.

original: dong ka'i me tog gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste ma btags pa'i gos sna tshogs pa bye ba phrag bcu gnyis rnyed do //
analyzed: dong ka'i me tog gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya ste ma btags pa'i gos sna tshogs pa bye ba phrag bcu gnyis rnyed do //
translated: One should offer into the fire one hundred thousand flowers of the don ga tree. One will obtain twelve million pieces of cloth of various kinds.

original: snying rjes sbyin du bcug pa dang / de bzhin du dad pa dang / lha bsnyen pa las gzhan ma yin pas 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rjes sbyin du bcug pa dang / de bzhin du dad pa dang / lha bsnyen pa las gzhan ma yin pas 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and giving through compassion, and likewise through faith, and through propitiating the gods, will not succeed.🔽

original: zhes de bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes de bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand it in this way.

original: rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di yang chos thams cad kyi nang du gtogs par rtog pa thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa'i rig pa 'di ni cho ga rgyas par bstan par lo brgya phrag gis kyang di dang / 'dis mdor bsdus nas bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di yang chos thams cad kyi nang du gtogs par rtog pa thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa'i rig pa 'di ni cho ga rgyas par bstan par lo brgya phrag gis kyang di dang / 'dis mdor bsdus nas bstan par mi nus so //
translated: This king of mantras is included among all the Dharmas, and this knowledge included among all the mantras. This extensive ritual cannot be taught even in a hundred years, but it is taught here in brief.

original: cho ga gzhan rnams su yang rig pa 'di sgrub pa'i cho ga de thams cad bsgrub par bya zhing /
analyzed: cho ga gzhan rnams su yang rig pa 'di sgrub pa'i cho ga de thams cad bsgrub par bya zhing /
translated: In all the other rituals, one should accomplish all the rituals of this knowledge.

original: de bzhin du gang nges par brjod pa'i las rnams sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang nges par brjod pa'i las rnams sgrub par byed do //
translated: And likewise, one will accomplish all the rites of the Uṣṇīṣa-cakravāḍa-mahā-mudrā-dhāraṇī.

original: rtog pa'i rgyal po 'dir rig pa'i sngags de rnams dang gang sngags rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba de rnams kho na yangs pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu gsal ba la sogs pa dang / rtog pa gzhan gyi chogs kyang bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'o //🔽de rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di'i sgrub @343a *//
analyzed: rtog pa'i rgyal po 'dir rig pa'i sngags de rnams dang gang sngags rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba de rnams kho na yangs pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu gsal ba la sogs pa dang / rtog pa gzhan gyi chogs kyang bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'o // de rtog pa'i rgyal po 'di'i sgrub @343a *//
translated: In this king of manuals, all those mantras and the things to be accomplished by those mantras are accomplished by the yoga of the great seal, which is the clear light of the exalted wisdom of inseparable bliss and emptiness, and also other concepts are accomplished.

original: thabs kyi spyod pa sbyin pa dang / sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi las dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i rig pa dang / sngags rnams dang /
analyzed: thabs kyi spyod pa sbyin pa dang / sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi las dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i rig pa dang / sngags rnams dang /
translated: The practice of this king of manuals is as follows: The practice of generosity, the various methods of practice, and so forth, the activities of the maṇḍala, and the worldly and transcendent desired knowledge mantras and vidyās🔽are all accomplished by the yoga of the great seal, which is the clear light of the exalted wisdom of inseparable bliss and emptiness, and also other concepts are accomplished.

original: rtog pa thams cad du rgyas par bstan pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i cho ga bcu rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i cho ga brgyad rnams kyang mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad du rgyas par bstan pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i cho ga bcu rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i cho ga brgyad rnams kyang mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The ten great seal rites and the eight great bodhisattva rites are also equalized.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: 'phags pa kun tu bzang po'i rtog pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po gzhon nu bzhi po'i rtog pa dang / yangs pa'i ri bo dang / kun tu ri bo dang / 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rgyud ste rtog pa chen po thams cad kyi spyod pa'i cho ga rnams su mnyam pa nyid du 'gro bar byed do; ;de bzhin kho na bdag gis brjod pa de dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa kun tu bzang po'i rtog pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po gzhon nu bzhi po'i rtog pa dang / yangs pa'i ri bo dang / kun tu ri bo dang / 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rgyud ste rtog pa chen po thams cad kyi spyod pa'i cho ga rnams su mnyam pa nyid du 'gro bar byed do; ;de bzhin kho na bdag gis brjod pa de dang /
translated: The noble Samantabhadra's Kalpa, the Kalpa of the four great bodhisattva youths, the Tantra of the Victory over the Three Worlds, and all the great Kalpas, they all lead to the state of equality.

original: sangs rgyas mtha' yas pas gsungs pa'i rtog pa'i rgyal po bde blag tu bsgrub par bya ste mtha' yas pa'i byang chub kyi pha rol tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mtha' yas pas gsungs pa'i rtog pa'i rgyal po bde blag tu bsgrub par bya ste mtha' yas pa'i byang chub kyi pha rol tu 'gro'o //
translated: I will speak of that alone, and easily accomplish the king of Kalpas taught by infinite buddhas, and go to the infinite perfection of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod bcom ldan 'das ma 'phags ma sgrol ma ral ba gyen brdzes kyi rtsa ba'i rtog pa thams cad thun mong pa'i cho ga'i rig pa'i le'u rab 'byams rdzogs so ////
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod bcom ldan 'das ma 'phags ma sgrol ma ral ba gyen brdzes kyi rtsa ba'i rtog pa thams cad thun mong pa'i cho ga'i rig pa'i le'u rab 'byams rdzogs so ////
translated: The chapter of knowledge of the ritual of all the common roots of the noble Tara, the basket of bodhisattvas, the Blessed Lady, the Upholder of the Crown, is complete.

original: phyag rgya'i le'u bri bar bgya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i le'u bri bar bgya'o //
translated: I will write the chapter on mudras.

original: de nas sems dpa' chen po phyag rgya yang dag par mgu bar byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs @343b nas dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi cho ga thun mong pa /
analyzed: de nas sems dpa' chen po phyag rgya yang dag par mgu bar byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs @343b nas dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi cho ga thun mong pa /
translated: Then the great being entered the samādhi called the seal that completely delights, and spoke the common ritual of all maṇḍalas,

original: rgyud thams cad gyi nang du gtogs pa /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad gyi nang du gtogs pa /

original: phyag rgya ri mo'i cho ga /
analyzed: phyag rgya ri mo'i cho ga /
translated: the ritual of the drawn seal.

original: rab tu 'dzum pa'i bzhin du gyur pas de'i 'og tu phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid gsungs par gyur to //
analyzed: rab tu 'dzum pa'i bzhin du gyur pas de'i 'og tu phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid gsungs par gyur to //
translated: With a face of complete joy, he then spoke the characteristics of the seals.

original: bcing pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: bcing pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni //

original: shes nas rab tu bzhag pa'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: shes nas rab tu bzhag pa'o // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi //
translated: are established through knowledge.🔽The three parts of the seals

original: rigs kyi phyag rgya cha gsum rnams //
analyzed: rigs kyi phyag rgya cha gsum rnams //
translated: of the families of all tathāgatas

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor kun nas 'bar //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor kun nas 'bar //
translated: are blazing maṇḍalas of the sun.

original: gtsug tor phyag rgya rdzogs pa yi //
analyzed: gtsug tor phyag rgya rdzogs pa yi //

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba ni //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba ni //
translated: with a rising maṇḍala of the sun.

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the seal of the cakravartin.

original: gtsug tor de nyid cung zad bteg /
analyzed: gtsug tor de nyid cung zad bteg /
translated: The uṣṇīṣa itself is slightly raised,

original: gtsug tor steng 'gro'i phyag rgya 'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor steng 'gro'i phyag rgya 'o //
translated: the seal of the uṣṇīṣa moving upward.

original: kun tu dkar ba gdugs dkar can //
analyzed: kun tu dkar ba gdugs dkar can //
translated: The all-white one is the one with the white parasol.

original: 'khor lo 'bar ba rnam par 'phro //
analyzed: 'khor lo 'bar ba rnam par 'phro //

original: gzi brjid phung po rdo rje nyid //
analyzed: gzi brjid phung po rdo rje nyid //
translated: The mass of splendor is the vajra itself.🔽The one who cannot be conquered by others is wrapped in three layers.

original: gzhan gyis mi thub lan gsum dkris; ;rgyal ba'i gtsug tor phyag rgya 'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub lan gsum dkris; ;rgyal ba'i gtsug tor phyag rgya 'o //
translated: The mudrā of the Jina’s uṣṇīṣa is

original: 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad lte bar bcas //
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad lte bar bcas //
translated: the wheel with eight spokes and a hub.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the wheel of Dharma.

original: padma rin chen nor bu ni //
analyzed: padma rin chen nor bu ni //

original: rin chen snying po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rin chen snying po'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: are the mudrā of the essence of jewels.

original: de nyid dkyil 'khor so sor gnas //
analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor so sor gnas //
translated: That itself is located in each maṇḍala.

original: las kun byed pa'i gdu bu can //
analyzed: las kun byed pa'i gdu bu can //
translated: The one with the bracelet that performs all activities

original: dbus su son pa dbus ma yin //🔽spyan de de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan //
analyzed: dbus su son pa dbus ma yin // spyan de de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan //
translated: is in the center, but not the center.🔽That eye is the eye of the tathāgatas.

original: de nyid rtsa ba can gyis dman; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod spu 'o //
analyzed: de nyid rtsa ba can gyis dman; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod spu 'o //
translated: That itself is the tathāgata’s ūrṇā,

original: rtse mo'i steng 'og nus pa'i mtshan //
analyzed: rtse mo'i steng 'og nus pa'i mtshan //
translated: which is the sign of power above and below the crown.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nus pa 'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nus pa 'o //
translated: That is the power of the tathāgatas.

original: 'bar ba'i tshogs pa gzhan mi thub //🔽'bar ba'i snying @344a *//
analyzed: 'bar ba'i tshogs pa gzhan mi thub // 'bar ba'i snying @344a *//
translated: The mass of flames is the invincible.

original: po'i dkyil 'khor ni //
analyzed: po'i dkyil 'khor ni //
translated: The maṇḍala of the essence of flames🔽is the mudrā of the tathāgatas.

original: thams cad lhung bzed sogs phyag rgya //
analyzed: thams cad lhung bzed sogs phyag rgya //
translated: All of them are mudras of the begging bowl, etc.

original: sngags sam yid kyi bye brag las //
analyzed: sngags sam yid kyi bye brag las //
translated: From the mantra or the mind,

original: de bzhin gshegs rigs phyag rgya 'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rigs phyag rgya 'o //
translated: The mudra of the Tathagata family.

original: padma 'dab brgyad phyi ma la //
analyzed: padma 'dab brgyad phyi ma la //

original: 'dab ma can rdzogs gang ba yi //🔽zla ba'i rnam pa cha dang bcas //
analyzed: 'dab ma can rdzogs gang ba yi // zla ba'i rnam pa cha dang bcas //
translated: The one with petals, complete and full,🔽The form of the moon with its digits,

original: rtsa ba'i phyag rgya padma can //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i phyag rgya padma can //
translated: The root mudra with the lotus.

original: padma g-yo ba'i steng du ni //
analyzed: padma g-yo ba'i steng du ni //
translated: On the moving lotus,🔽The one who definitely enters, desiring the jewel,

original: nges zhugs nor bu 'dod pa ni; ;phun tshogs byed pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: nges zhugs nor bu 'dod pa ni; ;phun tshogs byed pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Is the mudra of the one who accomplishes abundance.

original: rta mgrin dang ni sngon phyogs kyi //🔽padma yi ni sdong bu'o //
analyzed: rta mgrin dang ni sngon phyogs kyi // padma yi ni sdong bu'o //
translated: Hayagriva and in the eastern direction,🔽The lotus stalk.

original: padma dkar po gos dkar can //🔽ze 'bru de nyid grags ldan ma'i //
analyzed: padma dkar po gos dkar can // ze 'bru de nyid grags ldan ma'i //
translated: The white lotus is Pāṇḍaravāsinī.🔽The stamen is the famous Tārā.

original: autpal de nyid sgrol ma yi //
analyzed: autpal de nyid sgrol ma yi //

original: autpal ni zla ba yi 'o //
analyzed: autpal ni zla ba yi 'o //

analyzed: // yang 'dir sngags ni /
